llm_initializer.system_prompt: You are a Talmud scholar expert in translation.

metrics: TF-IDF cosine similarity (0-1 scale), similarity sentiment, BLEU, TER
prompt:
You are a Talmud scholar translating a tractate of the Talmud that contains both Hebrew and Aramaic.
                        Translate the following text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse.
                        Keep names and technical terms transliterated.
                        Preserve any quotes from Biblical verses and translate them.
                        Do not add any commentary or explanations. Your readers are also Talmud Scholars and do not require any Notes.

                        Talmudic text: {text}

                        English translation:

text: הַמְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ , רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מְקַנֵּא לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם, וּמַשְׁקָהּ עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד, אוֹ עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מְקַנֵּא לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם, וּמַשְׁקָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם.
כֵּיצַד מְקַנֵּא לָהּ? אוֹמֵר לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם: ״אַל תְּדַבְּרִי עִם אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי״, וְדִבְּרָה עִמּוֹ — עֲדַיִין הִיא מוּתֶּרֶת לְבֵיתָהּ וּמוּתֶּרֶת לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה.
נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ לְבֵית הַסֵּתֶר וְשָׁהֲתָה עִמּוֹ כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה — אֲסוּרָה לְבֵיתָהּ, וַאֲסוּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה. וְאִם מֵת — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
גְּמָ׳ מִכְּדֵי תַּנָּא מִנָּזִיר סָלֵיק, מַאי תְּנָא דְּקָא תָּנֵא סוֹטָה?
כִּדְרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לָמָּה נִסְמְכָה פָּרָשַׁת נָזִיר לְפָרָשַׁת סוֹטָה, לוֹמַר לָךְ: שֶׁכׇּל הָרוֹאֶה סוֹטָה בְּקִלְקוּלָהּ — יַזִּיר עַצְמוֹ מִן הַיַּיִן.

וְלִיתְנֵי סוֹטָה, וַהֲדַר לִיתְנֵי נָזִיר! אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא כְּתוּבּוֹת וּתְנָא ״הַמַּדִּיר״, תְּנָא נְדָרִים. וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא נְדָרִים — תְּנָא נָזִיר, דְּדָמֵי לִנְדָרִים. וְקָתָנֵי סוֹטָה, כִּדְרַבִּי.
״הַמְקַנֵּא״, דִּיעֲבַד — אִין, לְכַתְּחִילָּה — לָא. קָסָבַר תַּנָּא דִּידַן: אָסוּר לְקַנּאוֹת.

אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: כִּי הֲוָה פָּתַח רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ בְּסוֹטָה, אָמַר הָכִי: אֵין מְזַוְּוגִין לוֹ לְאָדָם אִשָּׁה אֶלָּא לְפִי מַעֲשָׂיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא יָנוּחַ שֵׁבֶט הָרֶשַׁע עַל גּוֹרַל הַצַּדִּיקִים״. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְקָשִׁין לְזַוְּוגָן כִּקְרִיעַת יַם סוּף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים מוֹשִׁיב יְחִידִים בַּיְתָה מוֹצִיא אֲסִירִים בַּכּוֹשָׁרוֹת״.

אִינִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם קוֹדֶם יְצִירַת הַוָּלָד בַּת קוֹל יוֹצֵאת וְאוֹמֶרֶת: בַּת פְּלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי, בֵּית פְּלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי, שְׂדֵה פְלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּזוּג רִאשׁוֹן, הָא — בְּזוּג שֵׁנִי.
רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מְקַנֵּא לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם וְכוּ׳. עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא בְּקִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה, אֲבָל בְּטוּמְאָה — עֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן.
וּתְנַן נָמֵי: עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֲנִי רָאִיתִי שֶׁנִּיטְמֵאת״ — לֹא הָיְתָה שׁוֹתָה.
מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְנָלַן דִּמְהֵימַן עֵד אֶחָד? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, בִּשְׁנַיִם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶחָד? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד אֶחָד בְּאִישׁ״.

מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד בְּאִישׁ״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא אֶחָד? מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֶחָד״? זֶה בָּנָה אָב: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״עֵד״ — הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם, עַד שֶׁיִּפְרוֹט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב ״אֶחָד״.
וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: תְּרֵי לֵית בַּהּ אֶלָּא חַד, ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה.
אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד אֶחָד בְּאִישׁ״, הָא לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא ״עֵד״ דְּסוֹטָה חַד הוּא. וְאִי אֲפִילּוּ חַד לֵיכָּא, אֶלָּא בְּמַאי מִיתַּסְרָא?
אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״עֵד אֵין בָּהּ״ — אֵין נֶאֱמָן בָּהּ.
אֵין נֶאֱמָן בָּהּ?! וְאֶלָּא מַאי בָּעֵי —
עַד דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי? לִישְׁתּוֹק קְרָא מִינֵּיהּ. דְּאָתְיָא ״דָּבָר״ ״דָּבָר״ מִמָּמוֹן. וַאֲנָא יָדַעְנָא, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַכׇּל עֵדֻיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה!
אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: סוֹטָה שָׁאנֵי, דְּרַגְלַיִם לְדָבָר, שֶׁהֲרֵי קִינֵּא לָהּ וְנִסְתְּרָה — לִיתְהֵימַן בַּהּ עֵד אֶחָד.
וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ דְּאֵין נֶאֱמָן בָּהּ וְשַׁרְיָא? וְהָא מִדִּכְתִיב ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — מִכְּלָל דַּאֲסוּרָה!
אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: אֵין נֶאֱמָן בָּהּ — עַד דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי, וּבִתְרֵי נָמֵי ״הִיא דְּלֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מְקַנֵּא לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״בָּהּ״ — בָּהּ וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי, ״בָּהּ״ — וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה.
וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״בָּהּ״ — וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי.
וְאֵימָא: ״בָּהּ״ וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה! סְתִירָה אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְטוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִסְתְּרָה וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״.
קִינּוּי נָמֵי אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְטוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״! הָא מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״בָּהּ״.
וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא סְתִירָה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן אוֹסַרְתָּהּ כְּטוּמְאָה.
אַדְּרַבָּה: קִינּוּי עָדִיף, שֶׁכֵּן עִיקָּר גָּרַם לָהּ.
אִי לָאו סְתִירָה, קִינּוּי מִי אִיכָּא? וְאִי לָאו קִינּוּי, סְתִירָה מַאי אַהֲנִי?
אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, סְתִירָה עֲדִיפָא, דְּאַתְחַלְתָּא דְטוּמְאָה הִיא.

מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הַמְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ — מְקַנֵּא עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד אוֹ עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וּמַשְׁקֶה לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם. הֵשִׁיבוּ חֲכָמִים: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר קְרָא ״בָּהּ״ — בָּהּ וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה.
וְאֵימָא: ״בָּהּ״ וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי? קִינּוּי אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְטוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״.
סְתִירָה נָמֵי אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְטוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִסְתְּרָה וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״?! הַהוּא, לְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר סְתִירָה — כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה, הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
הֵשִׁיבוּ חֲכָמִים: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף. מַאי נִיהוּ? דְּזִמְנִין דְּלָא קַנִּי וְאָמַר ״קַנַּאי״.
הָא לְמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ יֵשׁ לַדָּבָר סוֹף? זִמְנִין דְּלָא אִיסְתַּתַּר וְאָמַר ״אִיסְתַּתַּר״!
אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַף לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
אַף לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלֹא מִיבַּעְיָא לְמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ? אַדְּרַבָּה: לְמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ אִיכָּא עִיקָּר, הָתָם לֵיכָּא עִיקָּר!
אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר — הָכִי אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אַף לְמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.

אָמַר רַב חֲנִינָא מִסּוּרָא: לָא לֵימָא אִינִישׁ לְאִיתְּתֵיהּ בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה ״לֹא תִּיסָּתְרִי בַּהֲדֵי פְלוֹנִי״, דִּילְמָא קַיְימָא לַן כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר קִינּוּי עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וּמִיסְתַּתְּרָא, וְלֵיכָּא הָאִידָּנָא מֵי סוֹטָה לְמִיבְדְּקַהּ, וְקָאָסַר לַהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ אִיסּוּרָא דִּלְעוֹלָם.

אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מָה לְשׁוֹן ״קִינּוּי״ — דָּבָר הַמֵּטִיל קִנְאָה בֵּינָהּ לְבֵין אֲחֵרִים. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר קִינּוּי עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא יָדְעִי דְּקַנִּי לַהּ, וְאָמְרִי: מַאי דְּקַמָּא דְּקָא בָּדְלָה, וְאָתוּ לְמִיעְבַּד קִנְאָה בַּהֲדַהּ.

וְרַב יֵימַר בַּר רַבִּי שֶׁלֶמְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי אָמַר: דָּבָר הַמֵּטִיל קִנְאָה בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר קִינּוּי עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים, וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יָדְעִי דְּקַנִּי לַהּ, וְאִיהוּ הוּא דְּאָתֵי לְמִיעְבַּד קִנְאָה בַּהֲדַהּ.
human_translation: one who issues a warning to his wife Rabbi Eliezer says: issues a warning to her based on, two And gives to drink based on one witness or based on his own Rabbi Yehoshua says: issues a warning to her based on two and gives to drink based on two
How issue a warning to her says to her in the presence of two Do not speak with man so-and-so, and she spoke with him, she is still permitted to her home, and she is permitted to partake of teruma .

she entered into a secluded place and remained with enough to defiled, she is forbidden to her home And she is prohibited from partaking of teruma , And if dies she performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage,
Now, tanna arose from Nazir , What teach that teach Sota

in accordance with of Rabbi as it is taught Rabbi says: Why is the portion of a nazirite placed adjacent to the portion of a sota to tell you that anyone who sees a sota in her disgrace should renounce wine,

But let teach Sota first and then let teach Nazir , Since taught Ketubot , and taught One who vows, taught Nedarim , And since taught Nedarim , taught Nazir , which is similar to Nedarim And teaches Sota , in accordance with of Rabbi
One who issues a warning after the fact, yes, no, ab initio . the tanna of our holds is prohibited to issue a warning

Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: When Reish Lakish would introduce of sota say this: matches a woman to a man only according to his actions, as it is stated: “For the rod of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous” Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And it is as difficult to match as the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is stated “God makes the solitary individuals dwell in a house; He brings out prisoners into prosperity [ bakosharot ]”

Is that so But Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Forty days before an embryo is formed a Divine Voice issues forth and says: The daughter of so-and-so is to so-and-so; such and such a house is to so-and-so; such and such a field is to so-and-so. not difficult. This with regard to a first match [ zivug ], this with regard to a second match.
Rabbi Eliezer says: issue a warning to her based on, two disagree only with regard to warning and seclusion, but with regard to defilement one witness is deemed credible
And we learned also a single witness says: I saw that she was defiled, she would not drink
By Torah law, from where do we that one witness is deemed credible As the Sages taught and there is no witness [ ed ] against her” the verse is speaking of two
Or only even one the verse states: “One witness [ ed ] shall not rise up against a man

By inference from that is stated “A witness shall not rise up against a man” do I not know that it is one What the verse states “One This established a paradigm every place “witness [ ed ]” is stated there are two here, unless the verse specifies “one.”
And the Merciful One states: there are not two with regard to her; rather, one “And she was not taken,” she is forbidden.

But the reason that it is written “One witness shall not rise up against a man” but not this I would say witness concerning a sota is one and if there is not even one then with what does she become forbidden
was necessary enter your mind to say “There is no witness against her,” is not deemed credible with regard to her
is not deemed credible with regard to her? But what require
until there are two witnesses let the verse be silent from as is derived from “matter” “matter” monetary matters. And I know just as it does in all testimony in the Torah.
was necessary enter your mind to say a sota is different because a basis for the matter. Since issued a warning to her and she secluded one witness should be deemed credible with regard to her.
But how can you say is not deemed credible with regard to her and she permitted But from that it is written: “And she was not taken,” by inference who forbidden
was necessary enter your mind to say is not deemed credible with regard to her, until there are two and with two witnesses as well, it is when she was not seized teaches us

Rabbi Yehoshua says: issues a warning to her based on two What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehoshua? verse states: against her [ bah ]” With regard to it, but not with regard to warning. With regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion.
And Rabbi Eliezer says With regard to it, but not with regard to warning.
But say With regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion, seclusion is juxtaposed to defilement as it is written: “And she was defiled secretly”
warning is also juxtaposed to defilement, as it is written: “And he warned his wife, and she had become defiled” The Merciful One excluded bah ,
And what did you see stands to reason preferable seclusion as forbids her just as defilement
On the contrary, preferable warning as main cause her
If no seclusion, is there warning? And if no warning, what effectiveness does seclusion have?
Even so, preferable seclusion as is the beginning of defilement.

The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: One who issues a warning to his wife issues a warning based on one witness or based on his own and gives to drink based on two the Rabbis responded: According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter,
What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? The verse states: “ Bah ,” with regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion,
But say With regard to it, but not with regard to warning? warning is juxtaposed to defilement, as it is written: “And he warned his wife, and she had become defiled”
Seclusion is also juxtaposed to defilement, as it is written: “And she was defiled secretly” That is coming to how much measure of seclusion, sufficient for defilement.
The Rabbis responded: According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter. What is that times when did not warn but says: I warned her,
But according to our mishna, does the matter have an end? times when she did not seclude herself and her husband says: She secluded herself,
Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even according to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter.
even according to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, and it is not necessary according to our mishna. On the contrary, according to our mishna, is basis there, there is no basis

Rather, if it was stated, it was stated like this: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, even according to our mishna there is no end to the matter,

Rav Ḥanina of Sura says: In the present a man should not say to his wife: Do not seclude yourself with so-and-so. perhaps we maintain in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who says a warning based on his own and seclude herself and today water of a sota not to evaluate her he will forbidding her to himself an irrevocable prohibition.

Reish Lakish says: What term: Warning [ kinnui ]? a matter that causes anger [ kina ] between her and others, Apparently, he holds a warning based on own and everyone else will not know that her husband issued a warning to her, and they will say: What is this before us that she separates herself and they will come to act in anger with her.

And Rav Yeimar bar Rabbi Shelemya says in the name of Abaye: a matter that causes anger between him and her, Apparently, he holds a warning based on two witnesses. everyone knows that he issued a warning to her. And the husband is he who will come to act in anger with her,
llm_translation: The one who is jealous for his wife, Rabbi Eliezer says: he should be jealous for her based on the testimony of two, and he should make her drink based on the testimony of one witness, or based on his own testimony. Rabbi Yehoshua says: he should be jealous for her based on the testimony of two, and he should make her drink based on the testimony of two.

How does he express jealousy for her? He says to her in the presence of two: "Do not speak with so-and-so," and she speaks with him - she is still permitted to her husband and permitted to eat of the terumah.

She entered with him into the bridal chamber and stayed with him the amount of time required for impurity - she is forbidden to her husband's house, and forbidden to eat of the heave-offering. And if he dies - she performs the rite of halitzah and is not subject to levirate marriage.
Gemara: "Gemar mikdei tana minazir salek, mai tena deka tana sota?"
As Rabbi taught, Rabbi says: Why is the portion of Nazir juxtaposed to the portion of Sotah? To tell you: Anyone who sees a Sotah in her disgrace should abstain from wine.

The text reads as follows: "And let it teach about the Sotah, and then let it teach about the Nazir! Since it was taught: 'Written' and it was taught: 'One who vows,' it was taught about vows. And since it was taught about vows, it was taught about the Nazir, for the laws of the Nazir are similar to the laws of vows. And it was taught about the Sotah, in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi."
"The one who is zealous," when it is done - yes, initially - no. The Tanna of ours holds: It is forbidden to be zealous.

Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said: When Reish Lakish would begin discussing the topic of a Sotah, he would say the following: A man is only matched with a woman according to his deeds, as it is stated: "For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous." Rabbah bar bar Channah said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: And it is as difficult to match them as splitting the Red Sea, as it is stated: "God settles the solitary in a home; He releases prisoners into prosperity."

I? But didn't Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav: Forty days before the formation of the embryo, a heavenly voice emerges and proclaims: The daughter of so-and-so to so-and-so, the house of so-and-so to so-and-so, the field of so-and-so to so-and-so! This is not difficult: here - in the first pairing, there - in the second pairing.
Rabbi Eliezer says: He acquires her based on the testimony of two, etc. Until here, they only disagree regarding jealousy and denial, but in the case of impurity - one witness is believed.
And we learned in a Mishnah: If one witness says, "I saw that she became impure," - she is not believed.
From the Torah, from where do we derive that one witness is believed? For the Rabbis taught: "And there is no witness in it," the Scripture speaks of two.
Or is it only even in one? The Talmud teaches: "A single witness shall not stand up against a man."

From what is heard, as it is stated "A single witness shall not rise up against a man," do I not know that he is one? What is the teaching to say "one"? This is a father and son: wherever it is stated "witness," here there are two, until the verse explicitly states to you "one."
And the Merciful One said: "Two are not in it, only one," "And she was not caught" - it is prohibited.

Rather, the reason it is written, "No single witness shall rise up against a man," is not as you might think, that I would say that a witness in the case of a Sotah is only one. And if there is not even one, then with what is she punished?
It is necessary, as your mind has concluded, I say: "A witness is not in it" - he is not believed in it.
There is no faithful in it?! Rather, what does it require —
Until there are two? To silence a verse from it. For it is stated "word" "word" from money. And I know, since it is a matter of witnesses in the Torah!
It is necessary, as your mind has raised: Sotah is different, for it is a matter of legs, as he was jealous of her and she concealed herself - there is no reliance on one witness.
And who found saying that it is not reliable and permissible? But it is written, "And she was not caught" - implying that it is prohibited!
It is necessary, as your mind has raised: "He is not trustworthy in it" - until there are two, and with two, it is as if "she has not been caught," it is implied to us.

Rabbi Yehoshua says: He acquires her through the mouth of two, etc. What is the reason for Rabbi Yehoshua's statement? The verse says, "in her" - in her and not through a euphemism, "in her" - and not through concealment.
And Rabbi Eliezer says: "Bah" - and not by way of euphemism.
And why not say: "in it" and not "in concealment"! Concealment is connected to impurity, as it is written: "And it was hidden, and it became impure."
Dispute: is it connected to impurity, as it is written: "And he is jealous of his wife when she is defiled"! Here, the Merciful One has limited the scope "in her."
And what did you see? A contradiction is preferable, for thus you have prohibited it as impure.
Ad Ravva: Kinui adif, sheken ikar garam lah.
If it is not a contradiction, where is there a designation? And if it is not a designation, what relevance does a contradiction have?
Even so, contradiction is preferable, for it is the beginning of impurity.

Mishnah that not like this Tanna. As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: One who is zealous for his wife - he is zealous based on the testimony of one witness or based on his own testimony, and he gives her to drink based on the testimony of two witnesses. The Sages responded: According to the words of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter.
What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? The verse says "bah" - in it, and not in concealment.
And why not say: "in it" and not by way of euphemism? Euphemism is connected to impurity, as it is written: "And he is jealous of his wife when she is defiled."

Contradiction, indeed, is connected to impurity, as it is written: "And it was hidden, and it was impure"?! That, to what extent is the measure of contradiction - to the extent of impurity, that is when it comes.
The sages responded: According to the words of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter. What is the reason? At times when one does not acquire and says "zealous."
Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: Is there an end to our Mishnah? Sometimes it is not resolved, and he said, "It is not resolved!"
Said Rav Yitzchak son of Yosef said Rabbi Yochanan: Even according to the words of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter.
Even according to the words of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, and it is not necessary for our Mishnah? - Adrabah: There is a basis for our Mishnah, but there is no basis there!

Rather, if it was stated thus - so it was stated. Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: According to the words of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, even in our Mishnah, there is no end to the matter.

Rav Chanina from Sepphoris said: One should not say to his wife in our time, "Do not seclude yourself with so-and-so," for perhaps he is like Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said, "Suspicion arises by itself." And she will be secluded, and there is no longer the water of the Sotah to clarify her status, and he will cause her to be perpetually forbidden.

Reish Lakish said: What is the language of "kinui" - a matter that arouses jealousy between her and others. This implies that he holds that kinui is based on her own mouth, and the entire world does not know that he is jealous of her, and they say: What was in the beginning that separated, and then jealousy came upon her.

And Rav Yeimar, son of Rabbi Shelamya from the name of Abaye, said: A matter that arouses jealousy between him and her. This implies that he holds that a declaration of jealousy is made based on the testimony of two witnesses, and everyone knows that he is jealous of her, and he is the one who comes to cause jealousy between them.

sentences.text: הַמְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ , רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מְקַנֵּא לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם, וּמַשְׁקָהּ עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד, אוֹ עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מְקַנֵּא לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם, וּמַשְׁקָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם.
sentences.human_translation: one who issues a warning to his wife Rabbi Eliezer says: issues a warning to her based on, two And gives to drink based on one witness or based on his own Rabbi Yehoshua says: issues a warning to her based on two and gives to drink based on two
sentences.llm_translation: The one who is jealous for his wife, Rabbi Eliezer says: he should be jealous for her based on the testimony of two, and he should make her drink based on the testimony of one witness, or based on his own testimony. Rabbi Yehoshua says: he should be jealous for her based on the testimony of two, and he should make her drink based on the testimony of two.

sentences.text: כֵּיצַד מְקַנֵּא לָהּ? אוֹמֵר לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם: ״אַל תְּדַבְּרִי עִם אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי״, וְדִבְּרָה עִמּוֹ — עֲדַיִין הִיא מוּתֶּרֶת לְבֵיתָהּ וּמוּתֶּרֶת לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה.
sentences.human_translation: How issue a warning to her says to her in the presence of two Do not speak with man so-and-so, and she spoke with him, she is still permitted to her home, and she is permitted to partake of teruma .
sentences.llm_translation: How does he express jealousy for her? He says to her in the presence of two: "Do not speak with so-and-so," and she speaks with him - she is still permitted to her husband and permitted to eat of the terumah.

sentences.text: נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ לְבֵית הַסֵּתֶר וְשָׁהֲתָה עִמּוֹ כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה — אֲסוּרָה לְבֵיתָהּ, וַאֲסוּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה. וְאִם מֵת — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
sentences.human_translation: she entered into a secluded place and remained with enough to defiled, she is forbidden to her home And she is prohibited from partaking of teruma , And if dies she performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage,
sentences.llm_translation: She entered with him into the bridal chamber and stayed with him the amount of time required for impurity - she is forbidden to her husband's house, and forbidden to eat of the heave-offering. And if he dies - she performs the rite of halitzah and is not subject to levirate marriage.

sentences.text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּדֵי תַּנָּא מִנָּזִיר סָלֵיק, מַאי תְּנָא דְּקָא תָּנֵא סוֹטָה?
sentences.human_translation: Now, tanna arose from Nazir , What teach that teach Sota
sentences.llm_translation: Gemara: "Gemar mikdei tana minazir salek, mai tena deka tana sota?"

sentences.text: כִּדְרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לָמָּה נִסְמְכָה פָּרָשַׁת נָזִיר לְפָרָשַׁת סוֹטָה, לוֹמַר לָךְ: שֶׁכׇּל הָרוֹאֶה סוֹטָה בְּקִלְקוּלָהּ — יַזִּיר עַצְמוֹ מִן הַיַּיִן.
sentences.human_translation: in accordance with of Rabbi as it is taught Rabbi says: Why is the portion of a nazirite placed adjacent to the portion of a sota to tell you that anyone who sees a sota in her disgrace should renounce wine,
sentences.llm_translation: As Rabbi taught, Rabbi says: Why is the portion of Nazir juxtaposed to the portion of Sotah? To tell you: Anyone who sees a Sotah in her disgrace should abstain from wine.

sentences.text: וְלִיתְנֵי סוֹטָה, וַהֲדַר לִיתְנֵי נָזִיר! אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא כְּתוּבּוֹת וּתְנָא ״הַמַּדִּיר״, תְּנָא נְדָרִים. וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא נְדָרִים — תְּנָא נָזִיר, דְּדָמֵי לִנְדָרִים. וְקָתָנֵי סוֹטָה, כִּדְרַבִּי.
sentences.human_translation: But let teach Sota first and then let teach Nazir , Since taught Ketubot , and taught One who vows, taught Nedarim , And since taught Nedarim , taught Nazir , which is similar to Nedarim And teaches Sota , in accordance with of Rabbi
sentences.llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And let it teach about the Sotah, and then let it teach about the Nazir! Since it was taught: 'Written' and it was taught: 'One who vows,' it was taught about vows. And since it was taught about vows, it was taught about the Nazir, for the laws of the Nazir are similar to the laws of vows. And it was taught about the Sotah, in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi."

sentences.text: ״הַמְקַנֵּא״, דִּיעֲבַד — אִין, לְכַתְּחִילָּה — לָא. קָסָבַר תַּנָּא דִּידַן: אָסוּר לְקַנּאוֹת.
sentences.human_translation: One who issues a warning after the fact, yes, no, ab initio . the tanna of our holds is prohibited to issue a warning
sentences.llm_translation: "The one who is zealous," when it is done - yes, initially - no. The Tanna of ours holds: It is forbidden to be zealous.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: כִּי הֲוָה פָּתַח רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ בְּסוֹטָה, אָמַר הָכִי: אֵין מְזַוְּוגִין לוֹ לְאָדָם אִשָּׁה אֶלָּא לְפִי מַעֲשָׂיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא יָנוּחַ שֵׁבֶט הָרֶשַׁע עַל גּוֹרַל הַצַּדִּיקִים״. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְקָשִׁין לְזַוְּוגָן כִּקְרִיעַת יַם סוּף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים מוֹשִׁיב יְחִידִים בַּיְתָה מוֹצִיא אֲסִירִים בַּכּוֹשָׁרוֹת״.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: When Reish Lakish would introduce of sota say this: matches a woman to a man only according to his actions, as it is stated: “For the rod of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous” Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And it is as difficult to match as the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is stated “God makes the solitary individuals dwell in a house; He brings out prisoners into prosperity [ bakosharot ]”
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said: When Reish Lakish would begin discussing the topic of a Sotah, he would say the following: A man is only matched with a woman according to his deeds, as it is stated: "For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous." Rabbah bar bar Channah said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: And it is as difficult to match them as splitting the Red Sea, as it is stated: "God settles the solitary in a home; He releases prisoners into prosperity."

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם קוֹדֶם יְצִירַת הַוָּלָד בַּת קוֹל יוֹצֵאת וְאוֹמֶרֶת: בַּת פְּלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי, בֵּית פְּלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי, שְׂדֵה פְלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּזוּג רִאשׁוֹן, הָא — בְּזוּג שֵׁנִי.
sentences.human_translation: Is that so But Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Forty days before an embryo is formed a Divine Voice issues forth and says: The daughter of so-and-so is to so-and-so; such and such a house is to so-and-so; such and such a field is to so-and-so. not difficult. This with regard to a first match [ zivug ], this with regard to a second match.
sentences.llm_translation: I? But didn't Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav: Forty days before the formation of the embryo, a heavenly voice emerges and proclaims: The daughter of so-and-so to so-and-so, the house of so-and-so to so-and-so, the field of so-and-so to so-and-so! This is not difficult: here - in the first pairing, there - in the second pairing.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מְקַנֵּא לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם וְכוּ׳. עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא בְּקִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה, אֲבָל בְּטוּמְאָה — עֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: issue a warning to her based on, two disagree only with regard to warning and seclusion, but with regard to defilement one witness is deemed credible
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: He acquires her based on the testimony of two, etc. Until here, they only disagree regarding jealousy and denial, but in the case of impurity - one witness is believed.

sentences.text: וּתְנַן נָמֵי: עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֲנִי רָאִיתִי שֶׁנִּיטְמֵאת״ — לֹא הָיְתָה שׁוֹתָה.
sentences.human_translation: And we learned also a single witness says: I saw that she was defiled, she would not drink
sentences.llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: If one witness says, "I saw that she became impure," - she is not believed.

sentences.text: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְנָלַן דִּמְהֵימַן עֵד אֶחָד? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, בִּשְׁנַיִם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
sentences.human_translation: By Torah law, from where do we that one witness is deemed credible As the Sages taught and there is no witness [ ed ] against her” the verse is speaking of two
sentences.llm_translation: From the Torah, from where do we derive that one witness is believed? For the Rabbis taught: "And there is no witness in it," the Scripture speaks of two.

sentences.text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶחָד? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד אֶחָד בְּאִישׁ״.
sentences.human_translation: Or only even one the verse states: “One witness [ ed ] shall not rise up against a man
sentences.llm_translation: Or is it only even in one? The Talmud teaches: "A single witness shall not stand up against a man."

sentences.text: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד בְּאִישׁ״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא אֶחָד? מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֶחָד״? זֶה בָּנָה אָב: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״עֵד״ — הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם, עַד שֶׁיִּפְרוֹט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב ״אֶחָד״.
sentences.human_translation: By inference from that is stated “A witness shall not rise up against a man” do I not know that it is one What the verse states “One This established a paradigm every place “witness [ ed ]” is stated there are two here, unless the verse specifies “one.”
sentences.llm_translation: From what is heard, as it is stated "A single witness shall not rise up against a man," do I not know that he is one? What is the teaching to say "one"? This is a father and son: wherever it is stated "witness," here there are two, until the verse explicitly states to you "one."

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: תְּרֵי לֵית בַּהּ אֶלָּא חַד, ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה.
sentences.human_translation: And the Merciful One states: there are not two with regard to her; rather, one “And she was not taken,” she is forbidden.
sentences.llm_translation: And the Merciful One said: "Two are not in it, only one," "And she was not caught" - it is prohibited.

sentences.text: אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד אֶחָד בְּאִישׁ״, הָא לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא ״עֵד״ דְּסוֹטָה חַד הוּא. וְאִי אֲפִילּוּ חַד לֵיכָּא, אֶלָּא בְּמַאי מִיתַּסְרָא?
sentences.human_translation: But the reason that it is written “One witness shall not rise up against a man” but not this I would say witness concerning a sota is one and if there is not even one then with what does she become forbidden
sentences.llm_translation: Rather, the reason it is written, "No single witness shall rise up against a man," is not as you might think, that I would say that a witness in the case of a Sotah is only one. And if there is not even one, then with what is she punished?

sentences.text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״עֵד אֵין בָּהּ״ — אֵין נֶאֱמָן בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say “There is no witness against her,” is not deemed credible with regard to her
sentences.llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded, I say: "A witness is not in it" - he is not believed in it.

sentences.text: אֵין נֶאֱמָן בָּהּ?! וְאֶלָּא מַאי בָּעֵי —
sentences.human_translation: is not deemed credible with regard to her? But what require
sentences.llm_translation: There is no faithful in it?! Rather, what does it require —

sentences.text: עַד דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי? לִישְׁתּוֹק קְרָא מִינֵּיהּ. דְּאָתְיָא ״דָּבָר״ ״דָּבָר״ מִמָּמוֹן. וַאֲנָא יָדַעְנָא, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַכׇּל עֵדֻיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה!
sentences.human_translation: until there are two witnesses let the verse be silent from as is derived from “matter” “matter” monetary matters. And I know just as it does in all testimony in the Torah.
sentences.llm_translation: Until there are two? To silence a verse from it. For it is stated "word" "word" from money. And I know, since it is a matter of witnesses in the Torah!

sentences.text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: סוֹטָה שָׁאנֵי, דְּרַגְלַיִם לְדָבָר, שֶׁהֲרֵי קִינֵּא לָהּ וְנִסְתְּרָה — לִיתְהֵימַן בַּהּ עֵד אֶחָד.
sentences.human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say a sota is different because a basis for the matter. Since issued a warning to her and she secluded one witness should be deemed credible with regard to her.
sentences.llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has raised: Sotah is different, for it is a matter of legs, as he was jealous of her and she concealed herself - there is no reliance on one witness.

sentences.text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ דְּאֵין נֶאֱמָן בָּהּ וְשַׁרְיָא? וְהָא מִדִּכְתִיב ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — מִכְּלָל דַּאֲסוּרָה!
sentences.human_translation: But how can you say is not deemed credible with regard to her and she permitted But from that it is written: “And she was not taken,” by inference who forbidden
sentences.llm_translation: And who found saying that it is not reliable and permissible? But it is written, "And she was not caught" - implying that it is prohibited!

sentences.text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: אֵין נֶאֱמָן בָּהּ — עַד דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי, וּבִתְרֵי נָמֵי ״הִיא דְּלֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
sentences.human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say is not deemed credible with regard to her, until there are two and with two witnesses as well, it is when she was not seized teaches us
sentences.llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has raised: "He is not trustworthy in it" - until there are two, and with two, it is as if "she has not been caught," it is implied to us.

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מְקַנֵּא לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״בָּהּ״ — בָּהּ וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי, ״בָּהּ״ — וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: issues a warning to her based on two What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehoshua? verse states: against her [ bah ]” With regard to it, but not with regard to warning. With regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: He acquires her through the mouth of two, etc. What is the reason for Rabbi Yehoshua's statement? The verse says, "in her" - in her and not through a euphemism, "in her" - and not through concealment.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״בָּהּ״ — וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer says With regard to it, but not with regard to warning.
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer says: "Bah" - and not by way of euphemism.

sentences.text: וְאֵימָא: ״בָּהּ״ וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה! סְתִירָה אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְטוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִסְתְּרָה וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״.
sentences.human_translation: But say With regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion, seclusion is juxtaposed to defilement as it is written: “And she was defiled secretly”
sentences.llm_translation: And why not say: "in it" and not "in concealment"! Concealment is connected to impurity, as it is written: "And it was hidden, and it became impure."

sentences.text: קִינּוּי נָמֵי אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְטוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״! הָא מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״בָּהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: warning is also juxtaposed to defilement, as it is written: “And he warned his wife, and she had become defiled” The Merciful One excluded bah ,
sentences.llm_translation: Dispute: is it connected to impurity, as it is written: "And he is jealous of his wife when she is defiled"! Here, the Merciful One has limited the scope "in her."

sentences.text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא סְתִירָה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן אוֹסַרְתָּהּ כְּטוּמְאָה.
sentences.human_translation: And what did you see stands to reason preferable seclusion as forbids her just as defilement
sentences.llm_translation: And what did you see? A contradiction is preferable, for thus you have prohibited it as impure.

sentences.text: אַדְּרַבָּה: קִינּוּי עָדִיף, שֶׁכֵּן עִיקָּר גָּרַם לָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: On the contrary, preferable warning as main cause her
sentences.llm_translation: Ad Ravva: Kinui adif, sheken ikar garam lah.

sentences.text: אִי לָאו סְתִירָה, קִינּוּי מִי אִיכָּא? וְאִי לָאו קִינּוּי, סְתִירָה מַאי אַהֲנִי?
sentences.human_translation: If no seclusion, is there warning? And if no warning, what effectiveness does seclusion have?
sentences.llm_translation: If it is not a contradiction, where is there a designation? And if it is not a designation, what relevance does a contradiction have?

sentences.text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, סְתִירָה עֲדִיפָא, דְּאַתְחַלְתָּא דְטוּמְאָה הִיא.
sentences.human_translation: Even so, preferable seclusion as is the beginning of defilement.
sentences.llm_translation: Even so, contradiction is preferable, for it is the beginning of impurity.

sentences.text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הַמְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ — מְקַנֵּא עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד אוֹ עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וּמַשְׁקֶה לָהּ עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם. הֵשִׁיבוּ חֲכָמִים: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
sentences.human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: One who issues a warning to his wife issues a warning based on one witness or based on his own and gives to drink based on two the Rabbis responded: According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter,
sentences.llm_translation: Mishnah that not like this Tanna. As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: One who is zealous for his wife - he is zealous based on the testimony of one witness or based on his own testimony, and he gives her to drink based on the testimony of two witnesses. The Sages responded: According to the words of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter.

sentences.text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר קְרָא ״בָּהּ״ — בָּהּ וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה.
sentences.human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? The verse states: “ Bah ,” with regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion,
sentences.llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? The verse says "bah" - in it, and not in concealment.

sentences.text: וְאֵימָא: ״בָּהּ״ וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי? קִינּוּי אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְטוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״.
sentences.human_translation: But say With regard to it, but not with regard to warning? warning is juxtaposed to defilement, as it is written: “And he warned his wife, and she had become defiled”
sentences.llm_translation: And why not say: "in it" and not by way of euphemism? Euphemism is connected to impurity, as it is written: "And he is jealous of his wife when she is defiled."

sentences.text: סְתִירָה נָמֵי אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְטוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִסְתְּרָה וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״?! הַהוּא, לְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר סְתִירָה — כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה, הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
sentences.human_translation: Seclusion is also juxtaposed to defilement, as it is written: “And she was defiled secretly” That is coming to how much measure of seclusion, sufficient for defilement.
sentences.llm_translation: Contradiction, indeed, is connected to impurity, as it is written: "And it was hidden, and it was impure"?! That, to what extent is the measure of contradiction - to the extent of impurity, that is when it comes.

sentences.text: הֵשִׁיבוּ חֲכָמִים: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף. מַאי נִיהוּ? דְּזִמְנִין דְּלָא קַנִּי וְאָמַר ״קַנַּאי״.
sentences.human_translation: The Rabbis responded: According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter. What is that times when did not warn but says: I warned her,
sentences.llm_translation: The sages responded: According to the words of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter. What is the reason? At times when one does not acquire and says "zealous."

sentences.text: הָא לְמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ יֵשׁ לַדָּבָר סוֹף? זִמְנִין דְּלָא אִיסְתַּתַּר וְאָמַר ״אִיסְתַּתַּר״!
sentences.human_translation: But according to our mishna, does the matter have an end? times when she did not seclude herself and her husband says: She secluded herself,
sentences.llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: Is there an end to our Mishnah? Sometimes it is not resolved, and he said, "It is not resolved!"

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַף לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even according to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter.
sentences.llm_translation: Said Rav Yitzchak son of Yosef said Rabbi Yochanan: Even according to the words of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, there is no end to the matter.

sentences.text: אַף לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלֹא מִיבַּעְיָא לְמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ? אַדְּרַבָּה: לְמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ אִיכָּא עִיקָּר, הָתָם לֵיכָּא עִיקָּר!
sentences.human_translation: even according to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, and it is not necessary according to our mishna. On the contrary, according to our mishna, is basis there, there is no basis
sentences.llm_translation: Even according to the words of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, and it is not necessary for our Mishnah? - Adrabah: There is a basis for our Mishnah, but there is no basis there!

sentences.text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר — הָכִי אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אַף לְמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
sentences.human_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated like this: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, even according to our mishna there is no end to the matter,
sentences.llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus - so it was stated. Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: According to the words of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, even in our Mishnah, there is no end to the matter.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב חֲנִינָא מִסּוּרָא: לָא לֵימָא אִינִישׁ לְאִיתְּתֵיהּ בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה ״לֹא תִּיסָּתְרִי בַּהֲדֵי פְלוֹנִי״, דִּילְמָא קַיְימָא לַן כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר קִינּוּי עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וּמִיסְתַּתְּרָא, וְלֵיכָּא הָאִידָּנָא מֵי סוֹטָה לְמִיבְדְּקַהּ, וְקָאָסַר לַהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ אִיסּוּרָא דִּלְעוֹלָם.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Ḥanina of Sura says: In the present a man should not say to his wife: Do not seclude yourself with so-and-so. perhaps we maintain in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who says a warning based on his own and seclude herself and today water of a sota not to evaluate her he will forbidding her to himself an irrevocable prohibition.
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Chanina from Sepphoris said: One should not say to his wife in our time, "Do not seclude yourself with so-and-so," for perhaps he is like Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said, "Suspicion arises by itself." And she will be secluded, and there is no longer the water of the Sotah to clarify her status, and he will cause her to be perpetually forbidden.

sentences.text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מָה לְשׁוֹן ״קִינּוּי״ — דָּבָר הַמֵּטִיל קִנְאָה בֵּינָהּ לְבֵין אֲחֵרִים. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר קִינּוּי עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא יָדְעִי דְּקַנִּי לַהּ, וְאָמְרִי: מַאי דְּקַמָּא דְּקָא בָּדְלָה, וְאָתוּ לְמִיעְבַּד קִנְאָה בַּהֲדַהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Reish Lakish says: What term: Warning [ kinnui ]? a matter that causes anger [ kina ] between her and others, Apparently, he holds a warning based on own and everyone else will not know that her husband issued a warning to her, and they will say: What is this before us that she separates herself and they will come to act in anger with her.
sentences.llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: What is the language of "kinui" - a matter that arouses jealousy between her and others. This implies that he holds that kinui is based on her own mouth, and the entire world does not know that he is jealous of her, and they say: What was in the beginning that separated, and then jealousy came upon her.

sentences.text: וְרַב יֵימַר בַּר רַבִּי שֶׁלֶמְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי אָמַר: דָּבָר הַמֵּטִיל קִנְאָה בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר קִינּוּי עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים, וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יָדְעִי דְּקַנִּי לַהּ, וְאִיהוּ הוּא דְּאָתֵי לְמִיעְבַּד קִנְאָה בַּהֲדַהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And Rav Yeimar bar Rabbi Shelemya says in the name of Abaye: a matter that causes anger between him and her, Apparently, he holds a warning based on two witnesses. everyone knows that he issued a warning to her. And the husband is he who will come to act in anger with her,
sentences.llm_translation: And Rav Yeimar, son of Rabbi Shelamya from the name of Abaye, said: A matter that arouses jealousy between him and her. This implies that he holds that a declaration of jealousy is made based on the testimony of two witnesses, and everyone knows that he is jealous of her, and he is the one who comes to cause jealousy between them.

text: אַלְמָא קָסָבְרִי דְּאָסוּר לְקַנּאוֹת.
וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מוּתָּר לְקַנּאוֹת, מַהוּ לְשׁוֹן ״קִינּוּי״? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֵין ״קִינּוּי״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן הַתְרָאָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיְקַנֵּא ה׳ לְאַרְצוֹ״.

תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָדָם עוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה בַּסֵּתֶר וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַכְרִיז עָלָיו בְּגָלוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָבַר עָלָיו רוּחַ קִנְאָה״, וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן הַכְרָזָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְצַו מֹשֶׁה וַיַּעֲבִירוּ קוֹל בַּמַּחֲנֶה״.
רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵין אָדָם עוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִכְנַס בּוֹ רוּחַ שְׁטוּת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי תִשְׂטֶה אִשְׁתּוֹ״, ״תִּשְׁטֶה״ כְּתִיב.
תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: מִפְּנֵי מָה הֶאֱמִינָה תּוֹרָה עֵד אֶחָד בְּסוֹטָה — שֶׁרַגְלַיִם לַדָּבָר, שֶׁהֲרֵי קִינֵּא לָהּ, וְנִסְתְּרָה, וְעֵד אֶחָד מְעִידָהּ שֶׁהִיא טְמֵאָה.
אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיבָה קִינּוּי, בָּתַר סְתִירָה וְטוּמְאָה הוּא דִּכְתִיבָה!
אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״וְעָבַר״ — וּכְבָר עָבַר.
אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וְעָבַר לָכֶם כׇּל חָלוּץ״, הָכִי נָמֵי?

הָתָם, מִדִּכְתִיב ״וְנִכְבְּשָׁה הָאָרֶץ לִפְנֵי ה׳ וְאַחַר תָּשֻׁבוּ״ — מַשְׁמַע דִּלְהַבָּא. אֶלָּא הָכָא, אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כְּדִכְתִיבִי, ״וְעָבַר״ בָּתַר טוּמְאָה וּסְתִירָה — קִינּוּי לְמָה לִי?
תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אֵין אָדָם מְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִכְנְסָה בּוֹ רוּחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָבַר עָלָיו רוּחַ קִנְאָה וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״. מַאי רוּחַ?
רַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: רוּחַ טוּמְאָה. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: רוּחַ טׇהֳרָה.

וּמִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר רוּחַ טׇהֳרָה. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רוּחַ טׇהֳרָה — שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רוּחַ טוּמְאָה, רְשׁוּת וְחוֹבָה לְעַיּוֹלֵי לְאִינִישׁ רוּחַ טוּמְאָה בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ?
גּוּפָא: ״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה. ״לָהּ יִטַּמָּא״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.
״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.

אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לְרָבָא: לֵימָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ הָכִי פְּלִיגִי, דְּמָר אָמַר רְשׁוּת וּמָר אָמַר חוֹבָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכָא בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי.
״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.

מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — סָבַר לַהּ כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: כְּלַפֵּי שֶׁאָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״לֹא תִשְׂנָא אֶת אָחִיךָ בִּלְבָבֶךָ״, יָכוֹל כְּגוֹן זוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָבַר עָלָיו רוּחַ קִנְאָה וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״.
וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: קִינּוּי אַחֲרִינָא כְּתִיב.
וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? אַיְּידֵי דְּבָעֵי לְמִיכְתַּב ״וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״ ״וְהִיא לֹא נִטְמָאָה״ — כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״.
לְכִדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִישְׁנֵית — לֹא נִישְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
״לָהּ יִטַּמָּא״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.
מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱמֹר אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם לְנֶפֶשׁ לֹא יִטַּמָּא בְּעַמָּיו״, אִיצְטְרִיכָא לְמִיכְתַּב ״לָהּ יִטַּמָּא״.
וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִ״כִּי אִם לִשְׁאֵרוֹ״ נָפְקָא, ״לָהּ יִטַּמָּא״ לְמָה לִי — לְחוֹבָה.
וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לָהּ מִיטַּמֵּא, וְאֵין מִיטַּמֵּא לְאֵיבָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: Apparently, hold that prohibited to issue a warning.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? אַיְּידֵי דְּבָעֵי לְמִיכְתַּב ״וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״ ״וְהִיא לֹא נִטְמָאָה״ — כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״וְקִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael Since it needed to write “And she be defiled,” “And she be not defiled,” it is also written: “And he warned his wife,”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael? Because he requires for what is written "and she became impure" "and she did not become impure" — it is also written "and he is jealous of his wife."

sentences.text: לְכִדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִישְׁנֵית — לֹא נִישְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: as taught by the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Every passage that was stated and repeated was repeated only for the novel element introduced therein.
sentences.llm_translation: The Mishnah of the School of Rabbi Ishmael teaches: Any portion that was stated and repeated - it was not repeated except for a matter that was newly introduced in it.

sentences.text: ״לָהּ יִטַּמָּא״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.
sentences.human_translation: for her may he become impure” optional; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: mandatory
sentences.llm_translation: "To her, she shall become impure" - a domain, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: an obligation.

sentences.text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱמֹר אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם לְנֶפֶשׁ לֹא יִטַּמָּא בְּעַמָּיו״, אִיצְטְרִיכָא לְמִיכְתַּב ״לָהּ יִטַּמָּא״.
sentences.human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael? Since it is written: “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them: There shall none become impure for the dead among his people” was necessary to be written: “For her may he become impure,”
sentences.llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yishmael's opinion? - Because it is written: "Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them: None shall defile himself for the dead among his people." It was necessary for it to be written "to him shall he not defile himself."

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִ״כִּי אִם לִשְׁאֵרוֹ״ נָפְקָא, ״לָהּ יִטַּמָּא״ לְמָה לִי — לְחוֹבָה.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva derives from “Except for his kin, why do I “For her may he become impure”? To mandatory.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: "If it only came out for its own sake, 'it shall be unclean to her,' why do I need it? - for a liability."

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לָהּ מִיטַּמֵּא, וְאֵין מִיטַּמֵּא לְאֵיבָרֶיהָ.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael he may become impure for her, but he may not become impure to her limbs.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael: for her it is considered impure, but her limbs are not considered impure.

text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — אִם כֵּן, לִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לָהּ״ וְלִישְׁתּוֹק, ״יִטַּמָּא״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.

וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתַב ״לָהּ״, כְּתַב נָמֵי ״יִטַּמָּא״. לְכִדְתָנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִישְׁנֵית, לֹא נִישְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.

מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא תְחַיֶּה כׇּל נְשָׁמָה״, אִיצְטְרִיךְ נָמֵי לְמִיכְתַּב ״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״, לְמִישְׁרֵי אֶחָד מִכׇּל הָאוּמּוֹת שֶׁבָּא עַל הַכְּנַעֲנִית וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ.

דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְאֶחָד מִן הָאוּמּוֹת שֶׁבָּא עַל הַכְּנַעֲנִית וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְגַם מִבְּנֵי הַתּוֹשָׁבִים הַגָּרִים עִמָּכֶם מֵהֶם תִּקְנוּ״.

יָכוֹל אַף הַכְּנַעֲנִי שֶׁבָּא עַל אַחַת מִן הָאוּמּוֹת וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר הוֹלִידוּ בְּאַרְצְכֶם״, מִן הַנּוֹלָדִים בְּאַרְצְכֶם, וְלֹא מִן הַגָּרִים בְּאַרְצְכֶם.
וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִ״מֵּהֶם תִּקְנוּ״ נָפְקָא, ״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״ לְמָה לִי — לְחוֹבָה.
וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״בָּהֶם״ — וְלֹא בְּאַחֵיכֶם.
וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּאַחֵיכֶם — מִסֵּיפָא דִּקְרָא נָפְקָא: ״וּבְאַחֵיכֶם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִישׁ בְּאָחִיו לֹא תִרְדֶּה בוֹ בְּפָרֶךְ״.

וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״וּבְאַחֵיכֶם״, כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״בָּהֶם״. לְכִדְתָנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִישְׁנֵית, לֹא נִישְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.

אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זְנוּתָא בְּבֵיתָא כִּי קַרְיָא לְשׁוּמְשְׁמָא. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: תּוּקְפָּא בְּבֵיתָא כִּי קַרְיָא לְשׁוּמְשְׁמָא. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּאִיתְּתָא, אֲבָל בְּגַבְרָא לֵית לַן בַּהּ.

וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בַּתְּחִילָּה, קוֹדֶם שֶׁחָטְאוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, הָיְתָה שְׁכִינָה שׁוֹרָה עִם כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מִתְהַלֵּךְ בְּקֶרֶב מַחֲנֶךָ״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁחָטְאוּ נִסְתַּלְּקָה שְׁכִינָה מֵהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִרְאֶה בְךָ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר וְשָׁב מֵאַחֲרֶיךָ״.

אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — מְקַדַּמְתּוֹ וְהוֹלֶכֶת לְפָנָיו לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ צִדְקֶךָ״. וְכׇל הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — מְלַפַּפְתּוֹ וְהוֹלֶכֶת לְפָנָיו לְיוֹם הַדִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִלָּפְתוּ אׇרְחוֹת דַּרְכָּם יַעֲלוּ בַתֹּהוּ וְיֹאבֵדוּ״.

רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: קְשׁוּרָה בּוֹ כְּכֶלֶב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא שָׁמַע אֵלֶיהָ לִשְׁכַּב אֶצְלָהּ לִהְיוֹת עִמָּהּ״. ״לִשְׁכַּב אֶצְלָהּ״ — בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, ״לִהְיוֹת עִמָּהּ״ — לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
תְּנַן הָתָם, שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין:

וּמָה עֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינָהּ מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם, עֵדוּת הָאַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַיֵּים בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם?
תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ.

וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לְעֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה מֵעַתָּה: וּמָה עֵדוּת הָאַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּעֵד אֶחָד, עֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתִּתְקַיֵּים בְּעֵד אֶחָד?

תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר ״עַל פִּי שְׁנֵי עֵדִים אוֹ עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה עֵדִים יָקוּם דָּבָר״. מָה ״דָּבָר״ הָאָמוּר לְהַלָּן — עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים, אַף כָּאן — עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם.
הַאי מִ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״ נָפְקָא? מִ״בָּהּ״ נָפְקָא: בָּהּ — וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי, בָּהּ — וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בָּהּ״: בָּהּ — וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי, בָּהּ — וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה.

וְטוּמְאָה בְּעָלְמָא בְּלֹא קִינּוּי וּבְלֹא סְתִירָה, דְּלָא מְהֵימַן עֵד אֶחָד, מְנָלַן? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: ״עַל פִּי שְׁנֵי עֵדִים אוֹ עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה עֵדִים יָקוּם דָּבָר״. מָה ״דָּבָר״ הָאָמוּר לְהַלָּן — עֵדִים שְׁנַיִם, אַף כָּאן — עֵדִים שְׁנַיִם.
תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵי זוֹ הִיא עֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה — זוֹ עֵדוּת סְתִירָה, עֵדוּת אַחֲרוֹנָה — זוֹ עֵדוּת טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva If so, let the Merciful One write: for her,” and be silent. Why do I “May he become impure”? Learn from

And Rabbi Yishmael Since wrote: “For her,” also wrote: “May he become impure,” for as was taught by the school of Rabbi Yishmael. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Every passage that was stated and repeated, was repeated only for the novel element introduced therein.
“Of them may you take your bondmen forever” optional; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: mandatory,

What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael? Since it is written “You shall save alive nothing that breathes” it was necessary to write: “Of them may you take your bondmen forever” as well, to permit one from any of the nations who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Canaanite woman and she bore him a child. that you are permitted to purchase

as it is taught From where that one from the nations who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Canaanite woman, and she bore him a child, that you are permitted to purchase as a slave? The verse states: “Moreover, of the children of the strangers that do sojourn among you, of them may you buy”

might even a Canaanite who engaged in sexual intercourse with a woman from the nations and she bore him a child, that you are permitted to purchase as a slave, the verse states: “Which they have given birth to in your land,” from the born in your land but not from the reside in your land,
And Rabbi Akiva derives from “Of them may you buy.” why do I “Of them may you take your bondmen forever” to mandatory
And Rabbi Yishmael “of them,” but not of your brethren,
And Rabbi Akiva your brethren is derived from the latter of the verse, “But over your brethren the children of Israel you shall not rule, one over another, with rigor”

And Rabbi Yishmael since it is written: “But over your brethren,” it also writes “of them,” because of that was taught by the school of Rabbi Yishmael. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Every passage that was stated and repeated, was repeated only for the novel element introduced therein.

Rav Ḥisda says: Licentious in a home like a worm [ karya ] to sesame [ shumeshema ]. And Rav Ḥisda says: Anger in a home like a worm to sesame. this and that, with regard to the woman but with regard to the man, we do not have with regard to it,

And Rav Ḥisda says: Initially, before the Jewish people sinned, the Divine Presence resided with each and every one as it is stated: “For the Lord your God walks in the midst of your camp” Once they sinned, the Divine Presence withdrew from them, as it is stated “That He see no unseemly matter in you, and turn away from you”

Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Anyone who fulfills one mitzva in this world, precedes him and goes before him to the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And your righteousness shall go before you, And anyone who commits one transgression in this world, it shrouds him and goes before him to the Day of Judgment, as it is stated: “The paths of their way do wind, they go up into the waste, and are lost”
Rabbi Elazar says: is chained to him like a dog, as it is stated “That he listened not to her, to lie by her, or to be with her” “to lie by her” in this world, “to be with her” to the World-to-Come.
We learned elsewhere as, by right, should have been

And just as the first testimony which does not forbid her an irrevocable prohibition, is not established with fewer than two the final testimony which forbids her an irrevocable prohibition, is it not logical that it not be established with fewer than two
the verse states: “And there is no witness against her” any that there is against her

And now an a fortiori with regard to the first testimony And just as the final testimony which forbids her an irrevocable prohibition, is established with one witness, the first testimony, which does not forbid her an irrevocable prohibition, is it not logical that it should be established with one witness?

the verse states: because he has found some unseemly matter [ davar ] about her” and there, it states: “By the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses shall a matter [ davar ] be established” just as “matter” stated there by the mouth of two witnesses, so too here, by the mouth of two

this derived from: “Because he has found some unseemly matter about her” It is derived from: against her [ bah ]” With regard to it, but not with regard to warning. With regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion. should have
That is also what he is saying. The verse states: against her [ bah ],” With regard to it [ bah ], but not with regard to warning. With regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion.

And defilement in general, without warning and without seclusion, from where do we that one witness is not deemed credible? Here it is stated: “Because he has found some unseemly matter about her” and there it is stated: “By the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses shall a matter be established” just as “matter” stated there two witnesses, so too here, two witnesses.
The Sages taught which is the first testimony? This testimony of seclusion. the final testimony? This testimony of defilement.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva - If so, it should have been written "to her" and it should have been stated, "she shall be defiled." Why do I need it? Learn from it.

Rabbi Yishmael, since it is written "lah," he wrote "yitama." As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael. For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Any portion that was said and repeated, it was only repeated because of a matter that was newly introduced in it.
"Forever in them you shall serve" - permission, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: obligation.

What is the reason for Rabbi Yishmael's opinion? - Because it is written, "You shall not let any soul remain alive," it was also necessary for it to be written, "You shall surely smite the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is therein, and the cattle thereof, with the edge of the sword." This is to permit marrying one from all the nations that came upon the Canaanite woman and fathered a child from her, as you are permitted to acquire him.

Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive that one of the nations that came upon the Canaanite and fathered a son from her, that you are permitted to acquire him as a slave? The verse teaches: "And also from the children of the residents who dwell among you, from them you may acquire."

One might have thought that even a Canaanite who came from one of the nations and fathered a son from among them, that you are permitted to acquire him as a slave. The verse teaches: "Those that are born in your land," from those born in your land, and not from the strangers in your land.
Rabbi Akiva said: "From them they established." It emerged, "Forever in them you shall serve." Why do I need it? - For an obligation.
Rabbi Yishmael: "in them" — and not in your brothers.
Rabbi Akiva: "In your brothers" - from the end of the verse it is derived: "And among your brothers, the children of Israel, each man shall not rule over his brother with harshness."

Rabbi Yishmael: Through what is written "and in your brothers," it is also written "in them." This is in accordance with the teaching of the school of Rabbi Yishmael. For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Every portion that is stated and repeated, it is repeated only because of a matter that is newly introduced in it.

Rav Ḥisda said: Immorality in the house is like calling for a demon. And Rav Ḥisda said: A palm tree in the house is like calling for a demon. Both of them are harmful, but with a man, we have no concern about it.

And Rav Hisda said: Initially, before the Israelites sinned, the Divine Presence dwelled among each and every one of them, as it is stated: "For the Lord your God walks in the midst of your camp." Once they sinned, the Divine Presence departed from them, as it is stated: "And He will not see in you anything unseemly and turn away from you."

Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: Anyone who performs one mitzvah in this world - it precedes him and goes before him to the World to Come, as it is stated: "And your righteousness will go before you." And anyone who commits one transgression in this world - it surrounds him and goes before him on the day of judgment, as it is stated: "Their ways will be entangled in darkness, and they will be lost."
Rabbi Elazar says: Tied to him like a dog, as it is said: "And he did not listen to her to lie with her, to be with her." "To lie with her" - in this world, "to be with her" - in the world to come.
We learned there, that he was in judgment.

The first testimony, which does not prohibit it with a perpetual prohibition - it is not upheld in less than two. The last testimony, which prohibits it with a perpetual prohibition - is it not a law that is not upheld in less than two?
The Talmud teaches: "And there is no witness in her," anything that has in it.

And light and heavy for the testimony of the first from now: And what is the testimony of the latter, that you prohibit a prohibition forever — it is upheld by one witness, the testimony of the first, that you do not prohibit a prohibition forever — is it not a law that is upheld by one witness?

The Talmud teaches: "For he found in her the nakedness of a matter," and elsewhere it says, "By the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses shall a matter be established." What is the "matter" mentioned there? By the mouth of two witnesses. So too here - by the mouth of two witnesses.
This is the case when "he found in her nakedness" is derived? From "in her" it is derived: "in her" - and not by way of euphemism, "in her" - and not by way of concealment he requires it!
So did Nami say: The Talmud teaches "in it": in it - and not in a euphemism, in it - and not in a concealment.

Talmudic text: And impurity in general without designation and without contradiction, for not believed one witness, from where? It is stated here: "For he found in her the nakedness of a thing," and it is stated there: "By the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses shall a matter be established." What is the "matter" mentioned there - two witnesses, so too here - two witnesses.
The Rabbis taught: What is the first testimony? — This is contradictory testimony. What is the last testimony? — This is testimony of impurity.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — אִם כֵּן, לִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לָהּ״ וְלִישְׁתּוֹק, ״יִטַּמָּא״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.

sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva - If so, it should have been written "to her" and it should have been stated, "she shall be defiled." Why do I need it? Learn from it.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתַב ״לָהּ״, כְּתַב נָמֵי ״יִטַּמָּא״. לְכִדְתָנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִישְׁנֵית, לֹא נִישְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael Since wrote: “For her,” also wrote: “May he become impure,” for as was taught by the school of Rabbi Yishmael. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Every passage that was stated and repeated, was repeated only for the novel element introduced therein.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, since it is written "lah," he wrote "yitama." As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael. For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Any portion that was said and repeated, it was only repeated because of a matter that was newly introduced in it.

sentences.text: ״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.
sentences.human_translation: “Of them may you take your bondmen forever” optional; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: mandatory,
sentences.llm_translation: "Forever in them you shall serve" - permission, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: obligation.

sentences.text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא תְחַיֶּה כׇּל נְשָׁמָה״, אִיצְטְרִיךְ נָמֵי לְמִיכְתַּב ״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״, לְמִישְׁרֵי אֶחָד מִכׇּל הָאוּמּוֹת שֶׁבָּא עַל הַכְּנַעֲנִית וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael? Since it is written “You shall save alive nothing that breathes” it was necessary to write: “Of them may you take your bondmen forever” as well, to permit one from any of the nations who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Canaanite woman and she bore him a child. that you are permitted to purchase

This is to permit marrying one from all the nations that came upon the Canaanite woman and fathered a child from her, as you are permitted to acquire him.

sentences.text: דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְאֶחָד מִן הָאוּמּוֹת שֶׁבָּא עַל הַכְּנַעֲנִית וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְגַם מִבְּנֵי הַתּוֹשָׁבִים הַגָּרִים עִמָּכֶם מֵהֶם תִּקְנוּ״.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״בָּהֶם״ — וְלֹא בְּאַחֵיכֶם.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּאַחֵיכֶם — מִסֵּיפָא דִּקְרָא נָפְקָא: ״וּבְאַחֵיכֶם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִישׁ בְּאָחִיו לֹא תִרְדֶּה בוֹ בְּפָרֶךְ״.
