And after he went out, "for all the noise is noise with tumult," "in her sending forth she will contend with the wind." Why do I need it?

To Rav Chinana bar Papa. For Rav Chinana bar Papa said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact punishment from the world until the time of its release, as it is stated: "In a full measure, when sending her away, etc."

I? And Rava said: Three cups mentioned in Egypt, why? One that you drank in the days of Moses, and one that you drank in the days of Pharaoh the smiter, and one that you will drink in the future with her companions!

And if you will say, "There, they went and others came in their place" - and it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: "Minyamin the Egyptian convert was a friend of mine from the disciples of Rabbi Akiva." Minyamin the Egyptian convert said: "I am the first Egyptian, and I married a first Egyptian woman, so that my son's son may be permitted to enter the congregation!"

Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rav Chinana bar Papa said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact punishment from the king until the moment of his dismissal, as it is stated: "In the vessel of his sending forth, he will contend."

Ammemar teaches in the name of Rav Chinana bar Papa: What is the meaning of what is written: "For I am the Lord, I have not changed, and you, sons of Jacob, have not been consumed"? "I am the Lord, I have not changed" - I have not struck her for nothing, but I have changed her. "And you, sons of Jacob, have not been consumed" - this is as it is written: "My arrows will I spend upon them." My arrows are spent, yet they are not consumed.

Rav Hamnuna said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact punishment from a person until his measure is full, as it is stated: "When his belly is filled, He will send His fierce anger upon him" (Job 20:23).

Rav Chinana bar Papa expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "Sing praises, O you righteous, to the Lord; it is fitting for the upright to offer praise"? Do not read it as "it is fitting for praise," rather "a dwelling place for praise," this refers to Moses and David, that their enemies did not have dominion over them in their actions.

David - as it is written: "its gates have sunk into the ground." Moses - as the Master said: From the time the First Temple was built, the Tent of Meeting was hidden, its planks, bars, bolts, pillars, and sockets. Where? Rav Hisda said in the name of Avimi: Beneath the chambers of the Temple.

The Rabbis taught: If a woman gazes at a man who is not fitting for her, that which she desires is not granted to her, and that which is in her possession is taken away from her. For anyone who gazes at that which is not his, that which he desires is not granted to him, and that which is in his possession is taken away from him.

And so we find with the ancient serpent, that he placed his eyes on something that was not fitting for him - what he desired, they did not give him, and what was in his possession, they took from him. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: I said, "Let there be a king over every beast and wild animal," and now, "Cursed is he from all the beasts and from all the wild animals of the field."

I said, "He shall walk on a raised platform," now - "He shall walk on his belly." I said, "His food shall be the food of man," now - "Dust shall you eat." He said, "I will kill a man and take a wife," now - "I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your seed and her seed."

And so we find with Cain, and Korah, and Balaam, and Doeg, and Ahithophel, and Gehazi, and Absalom, and Adonijah, and Uzziah, and Haman - that they set their eyes on that which was not fitting for them. What they sought - was not given to them, and what was in their hands - was taken from them.

Talmudic text: In the thigh she began with a transgression, etc. Whence are these words? If you say because it is written: "When the Lord makes your thigh fall and your belly swell" - and it is written: "Her belly swells and her thigh falls"?

Abaye said: When one takes a drink, first the thigh, and then the stomach takes the drink, and the water, when it is checked, is like their path, the stomach first and then the thigh. Concerning a curse, it is written: "To swell the stomach and to shrink the thigh!" That one who is accustomed to it, like a priest, the stomach first and then the thigh, so as not to provoke the demon over the bitter waters.
The Mishnah teaches: "Shimshon followed after his eyes." Therefore, the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: "The Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes."

Avshalom was proud of his hair - therefore he was hanged by his hair. And because he came upon his father's ten concubines - therefore ten spears were thrust into him, as it is said: "And they surrounded him with ten men bearing Joab's weapons." And because he stole three hearts: the heart of his father, the heart of the court, and the heart of Israel, as it is said: "And Avshalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel" - therefore three darts were thrust into him, as it is said: "And he took three darts in his hand and thrust them into Avshalom's heart."

And so for the matter of the good: Miriam waited for Moses one hour, as it is said: "And his sister stood at a distance" — therefore the Israelites delayed for her seven days in the wilderness, as it is said: "And the people did not journey until Miriam was gathered."

Joseph merited to bury his father, and there is none among his brothers greater than him, as it is stated: "And Joseph went up to bury his father, and with him went up both chariots and horsemen." Who is greater than Joseph among us, for we only engage with him and not with Moses.

Moses merited with the bones of Joseph, and there is none in Israel greater than him, as it is stated: "And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him." Who is greater than Moses that only the place dealt with him, as it is stated: "And he buried him in the valley." They did not say this only about Moses, but about all the righteous, as it is stated: "And your righteousness shall go before you, the glory of the Lord shall gather you."

The Sages taught: "In the eyes of Samson, it was rebellious," as it is stated: "And Samson said to his father, 'Take her for me, for she is right in my eyes'" — therefore, the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: "And the Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes."
I am? And it is written: "And his father and his mother did not know that it was from the Lord." When he left her - after his righteousness he went.

It was taught: Rabbi says: The beginning of Samson's downfall was through a woman from Gaza; therefore, he fell through a woman from Gaza. The beginning of his downfall was through a woman from Gaza, as it is written: "And Samson went down to Gaza and saw there a harlot," therefore, he fell through a woman from Gaza, as it is written: "And they brought him down to Gaza."
And it is written: "And Samson went down to Timnah"? The beginning of his downfall was from there with Delilah.

"And it was after this, and he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, and her name was Delilah." It was taught: Rabbi says, if her name was not called "Delilah," it was fitting that she should be called Delilah, for she weakened his strength, she weakened his heart, she weakened his deeds.

He weakened his strength - as it is written: "And his strength departed from him." He weakened his heart - as it is written: "And Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart." He weakened his deeds - for the Divine Presence departed from him, as it is written: "And he did not know that the Lord had departed from him."

"And she saw that he had told her all his heart." How did she know? Rabbi Hanin said in the name of Rav: True words are recognizable. Abaye said: She knew it from that righteous man who does not utter the name of Heaven in vain. Since he said, 'I am a Nazirite of God,' she said, 'Now for sure he is speaking the truth.'

"And it came to pass, as she pressed him with her words all the days, that she urged him." What is meant by "she urged him"? Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi said: At the moment of completion of the act, it departed from beneath him.

"And now, please be cautious and do not drink wine and strong drink, and do not eat any unclean thing." What is "any unclean thing"? And furthermore: Until now, has she been eating unclean things?! Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi said: Things that are forbidden to a Nazirite.
"And God split the hollow place that is in Lechi." Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi said: It is a disgrace for something impure - therefore his life was suspended on something impure.
"And the spirit of the Lord began, etc." Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: The prophecy of our forefather Jacob faltered, as it is written: "Dan shall be a serpent by the way."

"Toward evening in the camp of Dan," said Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi: It teaches that the Divine Presence used to dance before him like a pair. It is written here: "Toward evening in the camp of Dan," and it is written there: "Pammon and Rimon."
"Between tzara'ah and eshta'ol," Rabbi Assi said: Tzara'ah and eshta'ol were two great mountains, and their peak touched one another.
"And he began to save Israel," said Rabbi Hama son of Rabbi Hanina:

sentences.text: פָּנֶיהָ מוֹרִיקוֹת. הִיא כָּחֲלָה לוֹ עֵינֶיהָ — לְפִיכָךְ עֵינֶיהָ בּוֹלְטוֹת. הִיא קָלְעָה לוֹ אֶת שְׂעָרָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן סוֹתֵר אֶת שְׂעָרָהּ. הִיא הֶרְאֲתָה לוֹ בְּאֶצְבַּע — לְפִיכָךְ צִיפּוֹרְנֶיהָ נוֹשְׁרוֹת. הִיא חָגְרָה לוֹ בְּצִילְצוֹל — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן מֵבִיא חֶבֶל הַמִּצְרִי וְקוֹשֵׁר לָהּ לְמַעְלָה מִדַּדֶּיהָ. הִיא פָּשְׁטָה לוֹ אֶת יְרֵיכָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ יְרֵיכָהּ נוֹפֶלֶת.
sentences.human_translation: her face becomes sallow she painted her eyes for therefore her eyes bulge she braided her hair for therefore a priest unbraids her hair she indicated to with a finger therefore her fingernails fall off; she girded herself for with a ribbon therefore a priest brings an Egyptian rope and ties for her above her breasts; she extended her thigh for therefore her thigh falls away
sentences.llm_translation: Her face is pale. She weakened his eyes - therefore her eyes protrude. She loosened her hair for him - therefore a priest shaves her hair. She pointed with her finger - therefore her nails grow long. She girded him with a belt - therefore a priest brings an Egyptian rope and ties it above her breasts. She uncovered her thigh for him - therefore her thigh falls.

sentences.text: הִיא קִיבְּלַתּוּ עַל כְּרֵיסָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ בִּטְנָהּ צָבָה. הִיא הֶאֱכִילַתּוּ מַעֲדַנֵּי עוֹלָם — לְפִיכָךְ קׇרְבָּנָהּ מַאֲכַל בְּהֵמָה. הִיא הִשְׁקַתְהוּ יַיִן מְשׁוּבָּח בְּכוֹסוֹת מְשׁוּבָּחִים — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן מַשְׁקֶה מַיִם הַמָּרִים בִּמְקִידָּה שֶׁל חֶרֶשׂ.
sentences.human_translation: She received upon her stomach, therefore her stomach swells; she fed him delicacies of the world, therefore her offering animal food, she gave him fine wine to drink in fine cups, therefore a priest gives her bitter water in an earthenware mekeida , to drink.
sentences.llm_translation: She received him on her lap - therefore her belly swelled. She fed him delicacies of the world - therefore her offering is animal food. She gave him excellent wine in excellent cups - therefore a priest gives bitter water in an earthenware vessel.

sentences.text: הִיא עָשְׂתָה בַּסֵּתֶר — ״יוֹשֵׁב בְּסֵתֶר עֶלְיוֹן״ שָׂם בָּהּ פָּנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעֵין נֹאֵף שָׁמְרָה נֶשֶׁף לֵאמֹר לֹא תְשׁוּרֵנִי עָיִן וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: She acted in secret; “Who dwell in secret, with the Most High” turns face to her, as it is stated: “The eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight, saying: No eye shall see me;
sentences.llm_translation: She did in secret - "He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High" placed in it a face, as it is said: "And the eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight, saying, 'No eye will see me,' etc."

sentences.text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: הִיא עָשְׂתָה בַּסֵּתֶר — הַמָּקוֹם פִּירְסְמָה בַּגָּלוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּכַּסֶּה שִׂנְאָה בְּמַשָּׁאוֹן תִּגָּלֶה רָעָתוֹ בְקָהָל (וְגוֹ׳)״.
sentences.human_translation: Alternatively, she acted in secret, the Omnipresent revealed it in the open, as it is stated: “Though his hatred be concealed with deceit, his wickedness shall be revealed before the congregation”
sentences.llm_translation: Another explanation: She did it in secret - the place she publicized openly, as it is stated: "Hatred is covered up with deceit, his wickedness will be revealed in the assembly (etc.)".

sentences.text: וּמֵאַחַר דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אַחַת לְאַחַת לִמְצֹא חֶשְׁבּוֹן״, ״כִּי כׇל סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ״ לְמָה לִי? לְכַמִּדָּה.
sentences.human_translation: And since Rabbi derives from: adding one thing to another, to find out the account” why do I “For every boot stamped with fierceness” to by the measure,
sentences.llm_translation: And after he went out from one to another to find an account, "For every load is with shaking," why do I need it? For measurement.

sentences.text: וּמֵאַחַר דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״כִּי כׇל סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ״, ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה״ לְמָה לִי?
sentences.human_translation: And since he derives it from “for every boot stamped with fierceness,” why do I “in full measure, when you send her away, you contend with her”
sentences.llm_translation: And after he went out, "for all the noise is noise with tumult," "in her sending forth she will contend with the wind." Why do I need it?

sentences.text: לְכִדְרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הָאוּמָּה עַד שְׁעַת שִׁילּוּחָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: to as by Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa, for Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish a nation until its time to be banished, as it is stated: “In full measure, when you send her away,
sentences.llm_translation: To Rav Chinana bar Papa. For Rav Chinana bar Papa said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact punishment from the world until the time of its release, as it is stated: "In a full measure, when sending her away, etc."

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: שָׁלֹשׁ(ה) כּוֹסוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּמִצְרַיִם, לָמָּה? אַחַת שֶׁשָּׁתָת בִּימֵי מֹשֶׁה, וְאַחַת שֶׁשָּׁתָת בִּימֵי פַּרְעֹה נְכֹה, וְאַחַת שֶׁעֲתִידָה לִשְׁתּוֹת עִם חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ!
sentences.human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rava say: Why three cups that are stated with regard to Egypt One that it drank in the days of Moses one that it drank in the days of Pharaoh Neco, and one that it will drink in the future with its companions,
sentences.llm_translation: I? And Rava said: Three cups mentioned in Egypt, why? One that you drank in the days of Moses, and one that you drank in the days of Pharaoh the smiter, and one that you will drink in the future with her companions!

sentences.text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָנָךְ אֲזַדוּ וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ — וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִנְיָמִין גֵּר הַמִּצְרִי הָיָה לִי חָבֵר מִתַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר מִנְיָמִין גֵּר הַמִּצְרִי: אֲנִי מִצְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, וְנָשָׂאתִי מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה, אַשִּׂיא לִבְנֵי מִצְרִית שְׁנִיָּה כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא בֶּן בְּנִי מוּתָּר לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל!
sentences.human_translation: And if you would say those have gone, and these are different ones, but isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Minyamin, an Egyptian convert, was a friend of mine from among the students of Rabbi Akiva, Minyamin the Egyptian convert said: I a first- Egyptian and I married first- Egyptian I will marry off my son, a second- to second- Egyptian in order that my son’s son will be permitted to enter into the congregation.
sentences.llm_translation: And if you will say, "There, they went and others came in their place" - and it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: "Minyamin the Egyptian convert was a friend of mine from the disciples of Rabbi Akiva." Minyamin the Egyptian convert said: "I am the first Egyptian, and I married a first Egyptian woman, so that my son's son may be permitted to enter the congregation!"

sentences.text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הַמֶּלֶךְ עַד שְׁעַת שִׁילּוּחוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rather, if was stated was stated like this: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish king until his time to be banished, as it is stated: “In full measure, when you send her away, you contend with her”
sentences.llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rav Chinana bar Papa said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact punishment from the king until the moment of his dismissal, as it is stated: "In the vessel of his sending forth, he will contend."

sentences.text: אַמֵּימָר מַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא אַהָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ לֹא שָׁנִיתִי וְאַתֶּם בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב לֹא כְלִיתֶם״? ״אֲנִי ה׳ לֹא שָׁנִיתִי״ — לֹא הִכֵּיתִי לְאוּמָּהּ וְשָׁנִיתִי לָהּ. ״וְאַתֶּם בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב לֹא כְלִיתֶם״ — הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״חִצַּי אֲכַלֶּה בָּם״. חִצַּי כָּלִין, וְהֵן אֵינָן כָּלִין.
sentences.human_translation: Ameimar teaches that of Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa with regard to this: What is which is written: “For I the Lord change not; and you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed” “For I the Lord change [ shaniti ] not” I did not strike a nation and repeat [ shaniti ] it, “And you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed,” This is as that which is written: I will consume My arrows upon them” My arrows are consumed and they, are not consumed
sentences.llm_translation: Ammemar teaches in the name of Rav Chinana bar Papa: What is the meaning of what is written: "For I am the Lord, I have not changed, and you, sons of Jacob, have not been consumed"? "I am the Lord, I have not changed" - I have not struck her for nothing, but I have changed her. "And you, sons of Jacob, have not been consumed" - this is as it is written: "My arrows will I spend upon them." My arrows are spent, yet they are not consumed.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הָאָדָם עַד שֶׁתִּתְמַלֵּא סְאָתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּמְלֹאות שִׂפְקוֹ יֵצֶר לוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Hamnuna says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish a person until his se’a , is filled, as it is stated: “In the fullness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits;
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact punishment from a person until his measure is full, as it is stated: "When his belly is filled, He will send His fierce anger upon him" (Job 20:23).

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״רַנְּנוּ צַדִּיקִים בַּה׳ לַיְשָׁרִים נָאוָה תְהִלָּה״? אַל תִּקְרֵי ״נָאוָה תְהִלָּה״, אֶלָּא ״נָוֶה תְהִלָּה״, זֶה מֹשֶׁה וְדָוִד, שֶׁלֹּא שָׁלְטוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶם.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous, praise is comely for the upright [ nava tehilla ]” Do not read Praise is comely [ nava ]; rather, A house [ naveh ] of praise. This Moses and David, whose enemies did not rule over their achievements,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Chinana bar Papa expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "Sing praises, O you righteous, to the Lord; it is fitting for the upright to offer praise"? Do not read it as "it is fitting for praise," rather "a dwelling place for praise," this refers to Moses and David, that their enemies did not have dominion over them in their actions.

sentences.text: דָּוִד — דִּכְתִיב: ״טָבְעוּ בָאָרֶץ שְׁעָרֶיהָ״. מֹשֶׁה — דְּאָמַר מָר: מִשֶּׁנִּבְנָה מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן נִגְנַז אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, קְרָשָׁיו קְרָסָיו וּבְרִיחָיו וְעַמּוּדָיו וַאֲדָנָיו. הֵיכָא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: תַּחַת מְחִילּוֹת שֶׁל הֵיכָל.
sentences.human_translation: David, as it is written: “Her gates are sunk into the ground” Moses, as the Master said: When the first Temple was built, the Tent of Meeting was sequestered, its boards, its clasps, and its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets. Where Rav Ḥisda says Avimi says: Beneath the tunnels of the Sanctuary.
sentences.llm_translation: David - as it is written: "its gates have sunk into the ground." Moses - as the Master said: From the time the First Temple was built, the Tent of Meeting was hidden, its planks, bars, bolts, pillars, and sockets. Where? Rav Hisda said in the name of Avimi: Beneath the chambers of the Temple.

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: סוֹטָה נָתְנָה עֵינֶיהָ בְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהּ, מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשָׁה — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהּ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָהּ — נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנָּה. שֶׁכׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ — מַה שֶּׁמְבַקֵּשׁ אֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ — נוֹטְלִין הֵימֶנּוּ.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught sota placed her eyes, on one who is unfit for her, That which she desired, is not given to her, And that which she had, was taken away from her, that anyone who places his eyes on that which is not his is not given what he desires, and that which he had is taken from him.
sentences.llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a woman gazes at a man who is not fitting for her, that which she desires is not granted to her, and that which is in her possession is taken away from her. For anyone who gazes at that which is not his, that which he desires is not granted to him, and that which is in his possession is taken away from him.

sentences.text: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּנָחָשׁ הַקַּדְמוֹנִי, שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לוֹ — מַה שֶּׁבִּיקֵּשׁ לֹא נָתְנוּ לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנּוּ. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מֶלֶךְ עַל כׇּל בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה, וְעַכְשָׁיו ״אָרוּר הוּא מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה וּמִכֹּל חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה״.
sentences.human_translation: And, so too, we found with regard to the primeval snake for he placed his eyes on that which was unfit for him, that which he desired was not given to him, and that which was in his possession was taken from him. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I said will be king over every domesticated animal and non-domesticated animal, but now he is cursed more than all the domesticated animals and all the non-domesticated animals of the field,
sentences.llm_translation: And so we find with the ancient serpent, that he placed his eyes on something that was not fitting for him - what he desired, they did not give him, and what was in his possession, they took from him. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: I said, "Let there be a king over every beast and wild animal," and now, "Cursed is he from all the beasts and from all the wild animals of the field."

sentences.text: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהַלֵּךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עַל גְּחוֹנוֹ יֵלֵךְ״. אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מַאֲכָלוֹ מַאֲכַל אָדָם, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עָפָר יֹאכַל״. הוּא אָמַר אֶהֱרוֹג אֶת אָדָם וְאֶשָּׂא אֶת חַוָּה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״אֵיבָה אָשִׁית בֵּינְךָ וּבֵין הָאִשָּׁה וּבֵין זַרְעֲךָ וּבֵין זַרְעָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: I said will walk upright, now he shall go on his belly; I said his food will be food a person, now he shall eat dust. said: I will kill Adam and marry Eve, now: “I will put enmity between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed”
sentences.llm_translation: I said, "He shall walk on a raised platform," now - "He shall walk on his belly." I said, "His food shall be the food of man," now - "Dust shall you eat." He said, "I will kill a man and take a wife," now - "I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your seed and her seed."

sentences.text: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּקַיִן וְקֹרַח וּבִלְעָם וְדוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל וְגֵחֲזִי וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם וַאֲדוֹנִיָּהוּ וְעוּזִּיָּהוּ וְהָמָן — שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהֶם. מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשׁוּ — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהֶם, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָם — נְטָלוּהוּ מֵהֶם.
sentences.human_translation: And so we found with regard to Cain, and Korah, and Balaam, and Doeg, and Ahithophel, and Gehazi, and Absalom, and Adonijah, and Uzziah, and Haman, who placed their eyes on that which is unfit for them, and what they desired was not given to them, and what they had was taken from them.
sentences.llm_translation: And so we find with Cain, and Korah, and Balaam, and Doeg, and Ahithophel, and Gehazi, and Absalom, and Adonijah, and Uzziah, and Haman - that they set their eyes on that which was not fitting for them. What they sought - was not given to them, and what was in their hands - was taken from them.

sentences.text: בַּיָּרֵךְ הִתְחִילָּה בַּעֲבֵירָה וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּתֵת ה׳ אֶת יְרֵכֵךְ נוֹפֶלֶת וְאֶת בִּטְנֵךְ צָבָה״ — וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְצָבְתָה בִטְנָהּ וְנָפְלָה יְרֵכָהּ״?
sentences.human_translation: She began her transgression with thigh From where are these matters If we say because it is written when the Lord does make your thigh to fall away, and your belly to swell” but isn’t written “And her belly shall swell, and her thigh shall fall away”
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: In the thigh she began with a transgression, etc. Whence are these words? If you say because it is written: "When the Lord makes your thigh fall and your belly swell" - and it is written: "Her belly swells and her thigh falls"?

sentences.text: אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי לָיֵיט — לָיֵיט תְּחִילָּה יָרֵךְ, וַהֲדַר בֶּטֶן לָיֵיט, וּמַיָּא כִּי בָּדְקִי — כִּי אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ בָּדְקִי, בֶּטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ. בִּקְלָלָה נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״לַצְבּוֹת בֶּטֶן וְלַנְפִּל יָרֵךְ״! הָהוּא דְּמוֹדַע לַהּ כֹּהֵן דְּבֶטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ, שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל מַיִם הַמָּרִים.
sentences.human_translation: Abaye said When curses he first curses the thigh and then he curses the stomach, but when the water evaluates it evaluates along its way first stomach and then thigh. in curse it is also written: and will cause your belly to swell, and your thigh to fall away” That that the priest notifies her that stomach first and then thigh, so that not cast aspersions on the bitter water.
sentences.llm_translation: Abaye said: When one takes a drink, first the thigh, and then the stomach takes the drink, and the water, when it is checked, is like their path, the stomach first and then the thigh. Concerning a curse, it is written: "To swell the stomach and to shrink the thigh!" That one who is accustomed to it, like a priest, the stomach first and then the thigh, so as not to provoke the demon over the bitter waters.

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ שִׁמְשׁוֹן הָלַךְ אַחַר עֵינָיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: Samson followed his eyes, therefore the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Philistines laid hold on him, and put out his eyes”
sentences.llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Shimshon followed after his eyes." Therefore, the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: "The Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes."

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ. וּלְפִי שֶׁבָּא עַל עֶשֶׂר פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְּנוּ בּוֹ עֶשֶׂר לוֹנְבִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּסֹבּוּ עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים נוֹשְׂאֵי כְּלֵי יוֹאָב״. וּלְפִי שֶׁגָּנַב שָׁלֹשׁ גְּנֵבוֹת: לֵב אָבִיו, וְלֵב בֵּית דִּין, וְלֵב יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְגַנֵּב אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶת לֵב אַנְשֵׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְקְעוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים בְּכַפּוֹ וַיִּתְקָעֵם בְּלֵב אַבְשָׁלוֹם״.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom was proud of his hair, therefore he was hanged by his hair. And because he engaged in sexual intercourse with ten of his father’s concubines therefore ten spears [ loneviyyot ] were put, into him, as it is stated: “And ten young men that bore Joab’s armor compassed about And because he stole three thefts The heart of his father, the heart of the court, and the heart of the Jewish people, as it is stated: “So Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel” therefore three spears were embedded into as it is stated: And he took three spears in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom,
sentences.llm_translation: Avshalom was proud of his hair - therefore he was hanged by his hair. And because he came upon his father's ten concubines - therefore ten spears were thrust into him, as it is said: "And they surrounded him with ten men bearing Joab's weapons." And because he stole three hearts: the heart of his father, the heart of the court, and the heart of Israel, as it is said: "And Avshalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel" - therefore three darts were thrust into him, as it is said: "And he took three darts in his hand and thrust them into Avshalom's heart."

sentences.text: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן הַטּוֹבָה: מִרְיָם הִמְתִּינָה לְמֹשֶׁה שָׁעָה אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְעַכְּבוּ לָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁבְעָה יָמִים בַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָעָם לֹא נָסַע עַד הֵאָסֵף מִרְיָם״.
sentences.human_translation: And the same with regard to the good Miriam waited for Moses one hour as it is stated: “And his sister stood afar off, Therefore the Jewish people delayed seven days for her as it is stated: and the people journeyed not until Miriam was brought in again”
sentences.llm_translation: And so for the matter of the good: Miriam waited for Moses one hour, as it is said: "And his sister stood at a distance" — therefore the Israelites delayed for her seven days in the wilderness, as it is said: "And the people did not journey until Miriam was gathered."

sentences.text: יוֹסֵף זָכָה לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו, וְאֵין בְּאֶחָיו גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבֹּר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ עִמּוֹ גַּם רֶכֶב גַּם פָּרָשִׁים״. מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא מֹשֶׁה.
sentences.human_translation: Joseph merited to bury his father, and there was none among his brothers greater than he as it is stated: “And Joseph went up to bury his father; And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen; Who, to us, a greater than Joseph, as it was none Moses who involved his
sentences.llm_translation: Joseph merited to bury his father, and there is none among his brothers greater than him, as it is stated: "And Joseph went up to bury his father, and with him went up both chariots and horsemen." Who is greater than Joseph among us, for we only engage with him and not with Moses.

sentences.text: מֹשֶׁה זָכָה בְּעַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף, וְאֵין בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״ — מִי גָּדוֹל מִמֹּשֶׁה שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״. לֹא עַל מֹשֶׁה בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא עַל כׇּל הַצַּדִּיקִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ צִדְקֶךָ כְּבוֹד ה׳ יַאַסְפֶךָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Moses merited in Joseph’s bones and there was none among the Jewish people greater than he, as it is stated: “And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him” Who a greater than Moses, as no one involved himself in his other than the Omnipresent as it is stated: “And He buried him in the valley Not only with regard to Moses did say but with regard to all the righteous individuals, as it is stated: “Your righteousness shall go before you and the glory of the Lord shall gather you in”
sentences.llm_translation: Moses merited with the bones of Joseph, and there is none in Israel greater than him, as it is stated: "And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him." Who is greater than Moses that only the place dealt with him, as it is stated: "And he buried him in the valley." They did not say this only about Moses, but about all the righteous, as it is stated: "And your righteousness shall go before you, the glory of the Lord shall gather you."

sentences.text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּעֵינָיו מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל אָבִיו אוֹתָהּ קַח לִי כִּי הִיא יָשְׁרָה בְעֵינָי״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught Samson rebelled with his eyes, as it is stated: And Samson said to his father: Get her for me; for she is pleasant in my eyes” Therefore, the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Philistines laid hold on him, and put out his eyes”
sentences.llm_translation: The Sages taught: "In the eyes of Samson, it was rebellious," as it is stated: "And Samson said to his father, 'Take her for me, for she is right in my eyes'" — therefore, the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: "And the Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes."

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ לֹא יָדְעוּ כִּי מֵה׳ הִיא״. כִּי אֲזַל מִיהָא — בָּתַר יַשְׁרוּתֵיהּ אֲזַל.
sentences.human_translation: Is that so? But isn’t it written: “But his father and his mother knew not that it was from the Lord; in any event when he went, he followed his inclination
sentences.llm_translation: I am? And it is written: "And his father and his mother did not know that it was from the Lord." When he left her - after his righteousness he went.

sentences.text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה. תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַזָּתָה וַיַּרְא שָׁם אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה וְגוֹ׳״, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיּוֹרִידוּ אוֹתוֹ עַזָּתָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says: His initial wrongdoing was in Gaza, therefore he was smitten in Gaza. His initial wrongdoing was in Gaza, as it is written: “And Samson went to Gaza, and saw there a harlot, Therefore, he was smitten in Gaza, as it is written: and they brought him down to Gaza,
sentences.llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says: The beginning of Samson's downfall was through a woman from Gaza; therefore, he fell through a woman from Gaza. The beginning of his downfall was through a woman from Gaza, as it is written: "And Samson went down to Gaza and saw there a harlot," therefore, he fell through a woman from Gaza, as it is written: "And they brought him down to Gaza."

sentences.text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד שִׁמְשׁוֹן תִּמְנָתָה״? תְּחִלַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ מִיהָא בְּעַזָּה הֲוָה.
sentences.human_translation: But isn’t it written “And Samson went down to Timnah, Gemara answers: In any event, his initial wrongdoing was in Gaza,
sentences.llm_translation: And it is written: "And Samson went down to Timnah"? The beginning of his downfall was from there with Delilah.

sentences.text: ״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי כֵן וַיֶּאֱהַב אִשָּׁה בְּנַחַל שֹׂרֵק וּשְׁמָהּ דְּלִילָה״. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אִילְמָלֵא לֹא נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״דְּלִילָה״ — רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה שֶׁתִּקָּרֵא דְּלִילָה: דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו.
sentences.human_translation: “And it came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah” It is taught Rabbi says: if she had not been called name Delilah, it would have been fitting that she be called Delilah, she weakened [ dildela ] his strength, she weakened his heart, she weakened his deeds,
sentences.llm_translation: "And it was after this, and he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, and her name was Delilah." It was taught: Rabbi says, if her name was not called "Delilah," it was fitting that she should be called Delilah, for she weakened his strength, she weakened his heart, she weakened his deeds.

sentences.text: דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסַר כֹּחוֹ מֵעָלָיו״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו — דְּאִיסְתַּלַּק שְׁכִינָה מִינֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוּא לֹא יָדַע כִּי ה׳ סָר מֵעָלָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: She weakened his strength, as it is written: and his strength went from him” She weakened his heart, as it is written: “And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, She weakened his deeds, as the Divine Presence left him, as it is written: But he knew not that the Lord was departed from him”
sentences.llm_translation: He weakened his strength - as it is written: "And his strength departed from him." He weakened his heart - as it is written: "And Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart." He weakened his deeds - for the Divine Presence departed from him, as it is written: "And he did not know that the Lord had departed from him."

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: נִיכָּרִין דִּבְרֵי אֱמֶת. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: יָדְעָה בּוֹ בְּאוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק דְּלָא מַפֵּיק שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם לְבַטָּלָה. כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר ״נְזִיר אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי״, אֲמַרָה: הַשְׁתָּא וַדַּאי קוּשְׁטָא קָאָמַר.
sentences.human_translation: “And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart” From where did she know Rabbi Ḥanin says Rav says: Words of truth are recognizable, Abaye says She knew about a righteous individual, that he would not express the name of Heaven in vain. Once he said: I have been a nazirite unto God she said: Now he is certainly saying the truth.
sentences.llm_translation: "And she saw that he had told her all his heart." How did she know? Rabbi Hanin said in the name of Rav: True words are recognizable. Abaye said: She knew it from that righteous man who does not utter the name of Heaven in vain. Since he said, 'I am a Nazirite of God,' she said, 'Now for sure he is speaking the truth.'

sentences.text: ״וַיְהִי כִּי הֵצִיקָה לּוֹ בִדְבָרֶיהָ כׇּל הַיָּמִים וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״. מַאי ״וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר בִּיאָה נִשְׁמְטָה מִתַּחְתָּיו.
sentences.human_translation: “And it came to pass, when she pressed him daily with her words, and urged him, What “and urged him”? Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: At the moment completion of intercourse, she slipped away from beneath him.
sentences.llm_translation: "And it came to pass, as she pressed him with her words all the days, that she urged him." What is meant by "she urged him"? Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi said: At the moment of completion of the act, it departed from beneath him.

sentences.text: ״וְעַתָּה הִשָּׁמְרִי נָא וְאַל תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר וְאַל תֹּאכְלִי כׇּל טָמֵא״. מַאי ״כׇּל טָמֵא״? וְתוּ: עַד הַשְׁתָּא דְּבָרִים טְמֵאִים קָאָכְלָה?! אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: דְּבָרִים הָאֲסוּרִים בְּנָזִיר.
sentences.human_translation: “Now therefore beware, I pray of you, and drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing” what “any unclean thing”? And more, until now was she eating unclean things, Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: items that are forbidden to a nazirite.
sentences.llm_translation: "And now, please be cautious and do not drink wine and strong drink, and do not eat any unclean thing." What is "any unclean thing"? And furthermore: Until now, has she been eating unclean things?! Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi said: Things that are forbidden to a Nazirite.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּבְקַע אֱלֹהִים אֶת הַמַּכְתֵּשׁ אֲשֶׁר בַּלֶּחִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הוּא אִיוָּה לְדָבָר טָמֵא — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלוּ חַיָּיו בְּדָבָר טָמֵא.
sentences.human_translation: “But God cleaved the hollow place that is in Lehi, Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: He desired something unclean, Therefore, his life was dependent on something unclean,
sentences.llm_translation: "And God split the hollow place that is in Lechi." Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi said: It is a disgrace for something impure - therefore his life was suspended on something impure.

sentences.text: ״וַתָּחֵל רוּחַ ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חָלְתָה נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהִי דָן נָחָשׁ עֲלֵי דֶרֶךְ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And the spirit of the Lord began [ vataḥel ] Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The prophecy of Jacob our forefather took effect [ ḥaleta ] as it is written: “Dan shall be a serpent in the way,
sentences.llm_translation: "And the spirit of the Lord began, etc." Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: The prophecy of our forefather Jacob faltered, as it is written: "Dan shall be a serpent by the way."

sentences.text: ״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁכִינָה מְקַשְׁקֶשֶׁת לְפָנָיו כְּזוֹג. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״פַּעֲמֹן וְרִמֹּן״.
sentences.human_translation: “To move him [ lefa’amo ] in Mahaneh Dan.” Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: teaches that the Divine Presence jangled before him, like a bell [ zog ], it is written here: “To move him [ lefa’amo ] in Mahaneh Dan,” and it is written there “A bell [ pa’amon ] and a pomegranate”
sentences.llm_translation: "Toward evening in the camp of Dan," said Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi: It teaches that the Divine Presence used to dance before him like a pair. It is written here: "Toward evening in the camp of Dan," and it is written there: "Pammon and Rimon."

sentences.text: ״בֵּין צׇרְעָה וּבֵין אֶשְׁתָּאוֹל״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: צׇרְעָה וְאֶשְׁתָּאוֹל שְׁנֵי הָרִים גְּדוֹלִים הָיוּ, וַעֲקָרָן שִׁמְשׁוֹן וּטְחָנָן זֶה בָּזֶה.
sentences.human_translation: “Between Zorah and Eshtaol.” Rabbi Asi says: Zorah and Eshtaol were two large mountains, and Samson uprooted them and ground them one against the other.
sentences.llm_translation: "Between tzara'ah and eshta'ol," Rabbi Assi said: Tzara'ah and eshta'ol were two great mountains, and their peak touched one another.

sentences.text: ״וְהוּא יָחֵל לְהוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא:
sentences.human_translation: and he shall begin to save Israel Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says:
sentences.llm_translation: "And he began to save Israel," said Rabbi Hama son of Rabbi Hanina:

text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּא לוֹ לִכְתּוֹב אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה, מֵאֵיזֶה מָקוֹם הוּא כּוֹתֵב?
מִ״וְאִם לֹא שָׁכַב אִישׁ וְגוֹ׳ וְאַתְּ כִּי שָׂטִית תַּחַת אִישֵׁךְ״,

וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הָאִשָּׁה״. וְכוֹתֵב: ״יִתֵּן ה׳ אוֹתָךְ לְאָלָה וְלִשְׁבֻעָה. וּבָאוּ הַמַּיִם הַמְאָרְרִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּמֵעַיִךְ לַצְבּוֹת בֶּטֶן וְלַנְפִּל יָרֵךְ״. וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״.
רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה מַפְסִיק.

רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב אֶלָּא ״יִתֵּן ה׳ אוֹתָךְ לְאָלָה וְלִשְׁבֻעָה וְגוֹ׳ וּבָאוּ הַמַּיִם הַמְאָרְרִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּמֵעַיִךְ וְגוֹ׳״. וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״.
גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? בְּהַאי קְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: ״וְכָתַב אֶת הָאָלוֹת הָאֵלֶּה הַכֹּהֵן בַּסֵּפֶר״.

רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״אָלוֹת״ — אָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ. ״הָאָלוֹת״ — לְרַבּוֹת קְלָלוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מֵחֲמַת בְּרָכוֹת. ״אֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה. ״הָאֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת אָמֵן.
וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כּוּלְּהוּ כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, ״אֶת״ — לְרַבּוֹת צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת.
וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר — אֶתִּים לָא דָּרֵישׁ.

וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — כּוּלְּהוּ בְּמִיעוּטֵי דָּרֵישׁ לְהוּ. ״אָלוֹת״ — אָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ. ״הָאָלוֹת״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מֵחֲמַת בְּרָכוֹת. ״אֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה. ״הָאֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת.
וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מַאי שְׁנָא הַאי הֵי דִּמְרַבֵּי בֵּיהּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הַאי הֵי דְּמַעֵיט בֵּיהּ?
הֵי דְּגַבֵּי(ה ד)רִיבּוּיָא — רִיבּוּיָא (הִיא), הֵי דְּגַבֵּי(ה ד)מִיעוּטָא — מִיעוּטָא.
וְהָא לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִכְּלָל לָאו אַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ הֵן?
אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: ״הִנָּקִי״ כְּתִיב.
דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה זָכוּ — שְׁכִינָה בֵּינֵיהֶן. לֹא זָכוּ — אֵשׁ אוֹכַלְתָּן.
אָמַר רָבָא: וּדְאִשָּׁה עֲדִיפָא מִדְּאִישׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא — הַאי מְצָרֵף, וְהַאי לָא מְצָרֵף.
אָמַר רָבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה הָבֵא עָפָר לְסוֹטָה? זָכְתָה — יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, לֹא זָכְתָה — תַּחְזוֹר לַעֲפָרָהּ.
דְּרֵישׁ רָבָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״וְאָנֹכִי עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת, אֵפֶר פָּרָה וַעֲפַר סוֹטָה.
וְהָאִיכָּא נָמֵי עֲפַר כִּיסּוּי הַדָּם!
הָתָם הֶכְשֵׁר מִצְוָה אִיכָּא, הֲנָאָה לֵיכָּא.
דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״אִם מִחוּט וְעַד שְׂרוֹךְ נַעַל״, זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת: חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת וּרְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין.
בִּשְׁלָמָא רְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָאוּ כׇּל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ נִקְרָא עָלֶיךָ״, וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ תְּפִלִּין שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ.
אֶלָּא חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת, מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה תְּכֵלֶת מִכׇּל מִינֵי צִבְעוֹנִין?

מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַתְּכֵלֶת דּוֹמֶה לַיָּם, וְיָם דּוֹמֶה לָרָקִיעַ, וְרָקִיעַ דּוֹמֶה לְכִסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּרְאוּ אֵת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתַחַת רַגְלָיו כְּמַעֲשֵׂה לִבְנַת הַסַּפִּיר וּכְעֶצֶם הַשָּׁמַיִם לָטֹהַר״, וּכְתִיב: ״כְּמַרְאֵה אֶבֶן סַפִּיר דְּמוּת כִּסֵּא״.
מַתְנִי׳ אֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב לֹא עַל הַלּוּחַ, וְלֹא עַל הַנְּיָיר, וְלֹא עַל
הַדִּיפְתְּרָא, אֶלָּא עַל הַמְּגִילָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּסֵּפֶר״.
וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב לֹא בְּקוֹמוֹס וְלֹא בְּקַנְקַנְתּוֹם, וְלֹא בְּכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁרוֹשֵׁם, אֶלָּא בִּדְיוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמָחָה״, כְּתָב שֶׁיָּכוֹל לִמָּחוֹת.

גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: מְגִילַּת סוֹטָה שֶׁכְּתָבָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה — פְּסוּלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — אָתְיָא ״תּוֹרָה״ ״תּוֹרָה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְעָשָׂה לָהּ הַכֹּהֵן אֵת כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״עַל פִּי הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר יוֹרוּךָ וְעַל הַמִּשְׁפָּט״, מָה מִשְׁפָּט בַּיּוֹם — אַף מְגִילַּת סוֹטָה בַּיּוֹם.
כְּתָבָהּ לְמַפְרֵעַ — פְּסוּלָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכָתַב אֶת הָאָלוֹת הָאֵלֶּה״, כִּי דִּכְתִיבָא.
כְּתָבָהּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל עָלֶיהָ שְׁבוּעָה — פְּסוּלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ״, וְאַחַר כָּךְ ״וְכָתַב״.
כְּתָבָהּ אִיגֶּרֶת — פְּסוּלָה. ״בַּסֵּפֶר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: When comes to write the scroll from what place does he write?
from “If no man has lain “But if you have gone astray while under your husband,

And he does not write “Then the priest shall cause the woman to swear but he does write “The Lord shall make you a curse and an oath And this water that causes the curse shall go into your bowels, and cause your belly to swell, and your thigh to fall away” but he does not write “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen”
Rabbi Yosei says: He does not interrupt

Rabbi Yehuda says: He writes nothing other “The Lord shall make you a curse and an oath And this water that causes the curse shall go into your bowels, And he does not write “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen.”
With regard to what do disagree? They disagree concerning the verse: “And the priest shall write these [ ha’eleh ] curses [ et ha’alot ] in a scroll”

Rabbi Meir, reasons: “ alot ,” actual curses. “ ha’alot ” to include curses that come on account of blessings, “ eleh ,” to exclude the curses that are in Mishne Torah , “ ha’eleh ” to exclude the commands and the acceptances “amen”
And Rabbi Yosei It all as you, said; “ et ” to include commands and acceptances,
And Rabbi Meir does not interpret et

And Rabbi Yehuda, he interprets all of as exclusionary: “ alot ” actual curses “ ha’alot ” to exclude curses that come on account of blessings. “ eleh ” to exclude the curses in Mishne Torah . “ ha’eleh ” to exclude commands and acceptances
But Rabbi Meir, what is different this heh that it amplifies and what is different that heh that it excludes
heh when near an amplifier is an amplifier. heh when near restrictor is a restrictor.
But Rabbi Meir does not from a negative you infer a positive
Rabbi Tanḥum says: It is written: you shall be free [ hinnaki ]”
Rabbi Akiva taught: a man [ ish ] and woman [ isha ] merit the Divine Presence between them. they do not merit fire consumes them.
Rava said: And that the woman is stronger than that the man. What is the reason are joined but they are not joined,

Rava says: For what did the Torah say: Bring dust for the sota ? she merits a child like our Patriarch Abraham will emerge from her, as it is written with regard to dust and ashes” if she does not merit she shall return to her dust,
Rava taught: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said: “And I am but dust and ashes” his children merited two mitzvot: The ashes of the heifer and the dust of the sota .
But there is also The dust covering the blood
There, does accessory to the mitzva there is no benefit
Rava taught: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said “That a thread nor a shoe strap his children merited two mitzvot: The thread of sky-blue and the strap of phylacteries.

Granted, the strap of phylacteries as it is written: “And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you; And it is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This is the phylacteries of the head,
But what is the thread of sky-blue As it is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What is different about sky-blue from all other colors

because sky-blue is similar to the sea, and the sea is similar to the sky, and the sky is similar to the Throne of Glory, as it is stated: “And they saw the God of Israel; and there was under His feet the like of a paved work of sapphire stone, and the like of the very heaven for clearness” and it is written: the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone”
does not write upon tablet, and not upon paper and not upon
diftera , rather, on a scroll as is stated: in a scroll”
And may not write with gum [ komos ], and not with iron sulfate [ kankantom ], nor with any substance that makes a mark but with ink as it is stated “And he shall blot a writing that can be erased

Rava says: A scroll of a sota that one wrote at night is unfit. What is the reason derived “law” “law.” It is written here, “And the priest shall execute upon her all this law” and it is written there, “According to the law, which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment, Just as judgment by day, so too the scroll of a sota by day.
If one wrote out of sequence, it is unfit, as it is written: “And shall write these curses as they are written
If one wrote before accepted the oath upon herself, is unfit, as it is stated: “Then shall cause to swear and afterward “And shall write
If one wrote as a letter, it is unfit, the Merciful One states “In a scroll,”
llm_translation: He taught: When one comes to write the Megillah, from which place does he write?
"If 'but if a man did not lie with you' and 'but you have gone astray under your husband,'"

The text reads: "And he does not write 'and the priest shall make the woman swear.' And he writes: 'May the Lord make you a curse and an oath. And these cursed waters shall enter your bowels to cause your belly to swell and your thigh to sag.' And he does not write 'and the woman shall say amen amen.'"
Rabbi Yosei says: did not interrupt.

Rabbi Yehuda says: A person does not write only "May the Lord make you a curse and an oath, etc." and "These bitter waters that cause the curse shall enter your body, etc." And he does not write "And the woman shall say, 'Amen, Amen.'"
Gemara: With what are they arguing? With this verse they are arguing: "And the kohen shall write these curses in the book."

Rabbi Meir holds: "Alot" - actual curses. "Ha'alot" - to include additional curses that come as a result of blessings. "Eleh" - to exclude the curses in the Torah. "Ha'eleh" - to exclude commandments and traditions. Amen.
Rabbi Yosei: All of them as you said, "et" - to include commandments and traditions.
And Rabbi Meir - Etim not expounded.

Rabbi Yehuda - all of them in the minority of interpretation to him. "Curses" - actual curses. "The curses" - to exclude the lighter curses that come as a result of blessings. "These" - to exclude the curses in the Mishnah Torah. "The these" - to exclude commandments and traditions.
Rabbi Meir, what is the difference between this one who increases it, and what is the difference between this one who decreases it?
Be as the one who multiplies - multiplication (it is), be as the one who diminishes - diminution.
And this case does not apply to Rabbi Meir from the category of "you shall surely hear, yes?"
Rabbi Tanhum said: "Hinnaki" is written.
Rabbi Akiva expounded: If a man and a woman are worthy, the Divine Presence abides between them; if they are not worthy, fire consumes them.
Rava said: And a woman is preferable to a man, what is the reason? This one (woman) is a binder, and this one (man) is not a binder.

Rava said: For what reason did the Torah say that the suspected adulteress brings dust for the ordeal? If she is innocent — she will have a son like our forefather Abraham, as it is written about him "dust and ashes." If she is not innocent — she will return to her dust.
Seek Ravah: In reward that Abraham our father said, "And I am dust and ashes," his sons merited two commandments, the ashes of the red heifer and the dust of the suspected adulteress.
And where is the blood covered with dust!
There, the qualification of the commandment is present, the pleasure is not present.
Rava expounded: In reward for what our father Abraham said, "From a thread to a shoelace," his sons merited two commandments: the thread of tekhelet and the strap of tefillin.

In truth, a fixed shel of tefillin, as it is written: "And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you." And it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: These are the tefillin of the head.
Rather, the thread of techelet, what is it? For it was taught, Rabbi Meir used to say: How is techelet different from all other colors?

Because the tekhelet resembles the sea, and the sea resembles the sky, and the sky resembles the Throne of Glory - as it is stated: "And they saw the God of Israel, and under His feet was like a work of sapphire brick, and like the essence of the heavens for purity," and it is written: "like the appearance of a sapphire stone, resembling a throne."
It was taught in a baraita: One may not write the Torah neither on a tablet, nor on paper, nor on...
The interpretation, rather on the Megillah, as it is stated: "In the book."
He does not write neither with a reed nor with a quill, nor with anything that is pointed, but with ink, as it is said: "And he shall blot it out," meaning that he can erase.

Talmudic text: Gemara said: Megillat Sotah that was written at night — invalid. What is the reason? It is derived from the repetition of "Torah, Torah." It is written here: "And the kohen shall perform upon her all this Torah," and it is written there: "According to the Torah that they will teach you and according to the judgment." Just as judgment is during the day, so too Megillat Sotah is during the day.
The writing of it for nullification — it is disqualified, as it is written: "And he shall write these curses," for it is written.
The writing before she accepts upon it a week - invalid, as it is stated: "And he shall cause her to drink," and afterwards "and write."
The writing of it, a letter — invalid. "In a book" the Merciful One said.

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּא לוֹ לִכְתּוֹב אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה, מֵאֵיזֶה מָקוֹם הוּא כּוֹתֵב?
sentences.human_translation: When comes to write the scroll from what place does he write?
sentences.llm_translation: He taught: When one comes to write the Megillah, from which place does he write?

sentences.text: מִ״וְאִם לֹא שָׁכַב אִישׁ וְגוֹ׳ וְאַתְּ כִּי שָׂטִית תַּחַת אִישֵׁךְ״,
sentences.human_translation: from “If no man has lain “But if you have gone astray while under your husband,
sentences.llm_translation: "If 'but if a man did not lie with you' and 'but you have gone astray under your husband,'"

sentences.text: וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הָאִשָּׁה״. וְכוֹתֵב: ״יִתֵּן ה׳ אוֹתָךְ לְאָלָה וְלִשְׁבֻעָה. וּבָאוּ הַמַּיִם הַמְאָרְרִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּמֵעַיִךְ לַצְבּוֹת בֶּטֶן וְלַנְפִּל יָרֵךְ״. וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״.
sentences.human_translation: And he does not write “Then the priest shall cause the woman to swear but he does write “The Lord shall make you a curse and an oath And this water that causes the curse shall go into your bowels, and cause your belly to swell, and your thigh to fall away” but he does not write “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen”
sentences.llm_translation: The text reads: "And he does not write 'and the priest shall make the woman swear.' And he writes: 'May the Lord make you a curse and an oath. And these cursed waters shall enter your bowels to cause your belly to swell and your thigh to sag.' And he does not write 'and the woman shall say amen amen.'"

sentences.text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה מַפְסִיק.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: He does not interrupt
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: did not interrupt.

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב אֶלָּא ״יִתֵּן ה׳ אוֹתָךְ לְאָלָה וְלִשְׁבֻעָה וְגוֹ׳ וּבָאוּ הַמַּיִם הַמְאָרְרִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּמֵעַיִךְ וְגוֹ׳״. וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He writes nothing other “The Lord shall make you a curse and an oath And this water that causes the curse shall go into your bowels, And he does not write “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen.”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A person does not write only "May the Lord make you a curse and an oath, etc." and "These bitter waters that cause the curse shall enter your body, etc." And he does not write "And the woman shall say, 'Amen, Amen.'"

sentences.text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? בְּהַאי קְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: ״וְכָתַב אֶת הָאָלוֹת הָאֵלֶּה הַכֹּהֵן בַּסֵּפֶר״.
sentences.human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? They disagree concerning the verse: “And the priest shall write these [ ha’eleh ] curses [ et ha’alot ] in a scroll”
sentences.llm_translation: Gemara: With what are they arguing? With this verse they are arguing: "And the kohen shall write these curses in the book."

sentences.text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״אָלוֹת״ — אָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ. ״הָאָלוֹת״ — לְרַבּוֹת קְלָלוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מֵחֲמַת בְּרָכוֹת. ״אֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה. ״הָאֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת אָמֵן.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Meir, reasons: “ alot ,” actual curses. “ ha’alot ” to include curses that come on account of blessings, “ eleh ,” to exclude the curses that are in Mishne Torah , “ ha’eleh ” to exclude the commands and the acceptances “amen”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: "Alot" - actual curses. "Ha'alot" - to include additional curses that come as a result of blessings. "Eleh" - to exclude the curses in the Torah. "Ha'eleh" - to exclude commandments and traditions. Amen.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כּוּלְּהוּ כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, ״אֶת״ — לְרַבּוֹת צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei It all as you, said; “ et ” to include commands and acceptances,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei: All of them as you said, "et" - to include commandments and traditions.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר — אֶתִּים לָא דָּרֵישׁ.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Meir does not interpret et
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir - Etim not expounded.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — כּוּלְּהוּ בְּמִיעוּטֵי דָּרֵישׁ לְהוּ. ״אָלוֹת״ — אָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ. ״הָאָלוֹת״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מֵחֲמַת בְּרָכוֹת. ״אֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה. ״הָאֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, he interprets all of as exclusionary: “ alot ” actual curses “ ha’alot ” to exclude curses that come on account of blessings. “ eleh ” to exclude the curses in Mishne Torah . “ ha’eleh ” to exclude commands and acceptances
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda - all of them in the minority of interpretation to him. "Curses" - actual curses. "The curses" - to exclude the lighter curses that come as a result of blessings. "These" - to exclude the curses in the Mishnah Torah. "The these" - to exclude commandments and traditions.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מַאי שְׁנָא הַאי הֵי דִּמְרַבֵּי בֵּיהּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הַאי הֵי דְּמַעֵיט בֵּיהּ?
sentences.human_translation: But Rabbi Meir, what is different this heh that it amplifies and what is different that heh that it excludes
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, what is the difference between this one who increases it, and what is the difference between this one who decreases it?

sentences.text: הֵי דְּגַבֵּי(ה ד)רִיבּוּיָא — רִיבּוּיָא (הִיא), הֵי דְּגַבֵּי(ה ד)מִיעוּטָא — מִיעוּטָא.
sentences.human_translation: heh when near an amplifier is an amplifier. heh when near restrictor is a restrictor.
sentences.llm_translation: Be as the one who multiplies - multiplication (it is), be as the one who diminishes - diminution.

sentences.text: וְהָא לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִכְּלָל לָאו אַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ הֵן?
sentences.human_translation: But Rabbi Meir does not from a negative you infer a positive
sentences.llm_translation: And this case does not apply to Rabbi Meir from the category of "you shall surely hear, yes?"

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: ״הִנָּקִי״ כְּתִיב.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum says: It is written: you shall be free [ hinnaki ]”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum said: "Hinnaki" is written.

sentences.text: דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה זָכוּ — שְׁכִינָה בֵּינֵיהֶן. לֹא זָכוּ — אֵשׁ אוֹכַלְתָּן.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Akiva taught: a man [ ish ] and woman [ isha ] merit the Divine Presence between them. they do not merit fire consumes them.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva expounded: If a man and a woman are worthy, the Divine Presence abides between them; if they are not worthy, fire consumes them.

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּדְאִשָּׁה עֲדִיפָא מִדְּאִישׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא — הַאי מְצָרֵף, וְהַאי לָא מְצָרֵף.
sentences.human_translation: Rava said: And that the woman is stronger than that the man. What is the reason are joined but they are not joined,
sentences.llm_translation: Rava said: And a woman is preferable to a man, what is the reason? This one (woman) is a binder, and this one (man) is not a binder.

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה הָבֵא עָפָר לְסוֹטָה? זָכְתָה — יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, לֹא זָכְתָה — תַּחְזוֹר לַעֲפָרָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rava says: For what did the Torah say: Bring dust for the sota ? she merits a child like our Patriarch Abraham will emerge from her, as it is written with regard to dust and ashes” if she does not merit she shall return to her dust,
sentences.llm_translation: Rava said: For what reason did the Torah say that the suspected adulteress brings dust for the ordeal? If she is innocent — she will have a son like our forefather Abraham, as it is written about him "dust and ashes." If she is not innocent — she will return to her dust.

sentences.text: דְּרֵישׁ רָבָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״וְאָנֹכִי עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת, אֵפֶר פָּרָה וַעֲפַר סוֹטָה.
sentences.human_translation: Rava taught: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said: “And I am but dust and ashes” his children merited two mitzvot: The ashes of the heifer and the dust of the sota .
sentences.llm_translation: Seek Ravah: In reward that Abraham our father said, "And I am dust and ashes," his sons merited two commandments, the ashes of the red heifer and the dust of the suspected adulteress.

sentences.text: וְהָאִיכָּא נָמֵי עֲפַר כִּיסּוּי הַדָּם!
sentences.human_translation: But there is also The dust covering the blood
sentences.llm_translation: And where is the blood covered with dust!

sentences.text: הָתָם הֶכְשֵׁר מִצְוָה אִיכָּא, הֲנָאָה לֵיכָּא.
sentences.human_translation: There, does accessory to the mitzva there is no benefit
sentences.llm_translation: There, the qualification of the commandment is present, the pleasure is not present.

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״אִם מִחוּט וְעַד שְׂרוֹךְ נַעַל״, זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת: חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת וּרְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין.
sentences.human_translation: Rava taught: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said “That a thread nor a shoe strap his children merited two mitzvot: The thread of sky-blue and the strap of phylacteries.
sentences.llm_translation: Rava expounded: In reward for what our father Abraham said, "From a thread to a shoelace," his sons merited two commandments: the thread of tekhelet and the strap of tefillin.

sentences.text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָאוּ כׇּל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ נִקְרָא עָלֶיךָ״, וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ תְּפִלִּין שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ.
sentences.human_translation: Granted, the strap of phylacteries as it is written: “And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you; And it is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This is the phylacteries of the head,
sentences.llm_translation: In truth, a fixed shel of tefillin, as it is written: "And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you." And it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: These are the tefillin of the head.

sentences.text: אֶלָּא חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת, מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה תְּכֵלֶת מִכׇּל מִינֵי צִבְעוֹנִין?
sentences.human_translation: But what is the thread of sky-blue As it is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What is different about sky-blue from all other colors
sentences.llm_translation: Rather, the thread of techelet, what is it? For it was taught, Rabbi Meir used to say: How is techelet different from all other colors?

sentences.text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַתְּכֵלֶת דּוֹמֶה לַיָּם, וְיָם דּוֹמֶה לָרָקִיעַ, וְרָקִיעַ דּוֹמֶה לְכִסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּרְאוּ אֵת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתַחַת רַגְלָיו כְּמַעֲשֵׂה לִבְנַת הַסַּפִּיר וּכְעֶצֶם הַשָּׁמַיִם לָטֹהַר״, וּכְתִיב: ״כְּמַרְאֵה אֶבֶן סַפִּיר דְּמוּת כִּסֵּא״.
sentences.human_translation: because sky-blue is similar to the sea, and the sea is similar to the sky, and the sky is similar to the Throne of Glory, as it is stated: “And they saw the God of Israel; and there was under His feet the like of a paved work of sapphire stone, and the like of the very heaven for clearness” and it is written: the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone”
sentences.llm_translation: Because the tekhelet resembles the sea, and the sea resembles the sky, and the sky resembles the Throne of Glory - as it is stated: "And they saw the God of Israel, and under His feet was like a work of sapphire brick, and like the essence of the heavens for purity," and it is written: "like the appearance of a sapphire stone, resembling a throne."

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב לֹא עַל הַלּוּחַ, וְלֹא עַל הַנְּיָיר, וְלֹא עַל
sentences.human_translation: does not write upon tablet, and not upon paper and not upon
sentences.llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: One may not write the Torah neither on a tablet, nor on paper, nor on...

sentences.text: הַדִּיפְתְּרָא, אֶלָּא עַל הַמְּגִילָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּסֵּפֶר״.
sentences.human_translation: diftera , rather, on a scroll as is stated: in a scroll”
sentences.llm_translation: The interpretation, rather on the Megillah, as it is stated: "In the book."

sentences.text: וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב לֹא בְּקוֹמוֹס וְלֹא בְּקַנְקַנְתּוֹם, וְלֹא בְּכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁרוֹשֵׁם, אֶלָּא בִּדְיוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמָחָה״, כְּתָב שֶׁיָּכוֹל לִמָּחוֹת.
sentences.human_translation: And may not write with gum [ komos ], and not with iron sulfate [ kankantom ], nor with any substance that makes a mark but with ink as it is stated “And he shall blot a writing that can be erased
sentences.llm_translation: He does not write neither with a reed nor with a quill, nor with anything that is pointed, but with ink, as it is said: "And he shall blot it out," meaning that he can erase.

sentences.text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: מְגִילַּת סוֹטָה שֶׁכְּתָבָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה — פְּסוּלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — אָתְיָא ״תּוֹרָה״ ״תּוֹרָה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְעָשָׂה לָהּ הַכֹּהֵן אֵת כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״עַל פִּי הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר יוֹרוּךָ וְעַל הַמִּשְׁפָּט״, מָה מִשְׁפָּט בַּיּוֹם — אַף מְגִילַּת סוֹטָה בַּיּוֹם.
sentences.human_translation: Rava says: A scroll of a sota that one wrote at night is unfit. What is the reason derived “law” “law.” It is written here, “And the priest shall execute upon her all this law” and it is written there, “According to the law, which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment, Just as judgment by day, so too the scroll of a sota by day.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said: Megillat Sotah that was written at night — invalid. What is the reason? It is derived from the repetition of "Torah, Torah." It is written here: "And the kohen shall perform upon her all this Torah," and it is written there: "According to the Torah that they will teach you and according to the judgment." Just as judgment is during the day, so too Megillat Sotah is during the day.

sentences.text: כְּתָבָהּ לְמַפְרֵעַ — פְּסוּלָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכָתַב אֶת הָאָלוֹת הָאֵלֶּה״, כִּי דִּכְתִיבָא.
sentences.human_translation: If one wrote out of sequence, it is unfit, as it is written: “And shall write these curses as they are written
sentences.llm_translation: The writing of it for nullification — it is disqualified, as it is written: "And he shall write these curses," for it is written.

sentences.text: כְּתָבָהּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל עָלֶיהָ שְׁבוּעָה — פְּסוּלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ״, וְאַחַר כָּךְ ״וְכָתַב״.
sentences.human_translation: If one wrote before accepted the oath upon herself, is unfit, as it is stated: “Then shall cause to swear and afterward “And shall write
sentences.llm_translation: The writing before she accepts upon it a week - invalid, as it is stated: "And he shall cause her to drink," and afterwards "and write."

sentences.text: כְּתָבָהּ אִיגֶּרֶת — פְּסוּלָה. ״בַּסֵּפֶר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא.
sentences.human_translation: If one wrote as a letter, it is unfit, the Merciful One states “In a scroll,”
sentences.llm_translation: The writing of it, a letter — invalid. "In a book" the Merciful One said.

text: אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.
״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״. מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ, חַשְּׁבַהּ לְזוֹנָה?!

אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.
״הִיא מוּצֵאת״. ״הִיא מִיתּוֹצֵאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ סִימָנֶיהָ בָּא סַמָּאֵל וְרִיחֲקָן, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְקֵירְבָן.

הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.

״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.

״הַכֶּר נָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר לְאָבִיו — בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר: ״הַכֶּר נָא הַכְּתֹנֶת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ: ״הַכֶּר נָא לְמִי״.
״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.

״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.

יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.

״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.

אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.

לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.

״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.

״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
human_translation: rather vayyakri , and he caused to call. teaches that Abraham our forefather caused the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, to be called in the mouth of all passersby. How so? After ate and drank, they arose to bless him. He said to them: But did you eat from mine? you ate from the God of the world. you thank and praise and bless the One Who spoke and the world was
“When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a prostitute, for she had covered her face” Because she had covered her face he thought her to be a prostitute?

Rabbi Elazar says: that covered her face in the home of her father-in-law, As Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Any daughter-in-law who is modest in the house of her father-in-law merits that kings and prophets emerge from her. From where do we From Tamar. Prophets as it is written: “The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz” Kings from David. And Rabbi Levi says: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors: Amoz, and Amaziah, were brothers.
“When she was brought forth [ mutzet ], It should have When she was mitutzet . Rabbi Elazar says: After her signs, were brought out, Samael came and distanced them Gabriel came and moved closer

This is as it is written: “For the leader, upon yonat eilem reḥokim , a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” Rabbi Yoḥanan says From the moment that her signs were distanced [ reḥokim ], she became like a mute dove [ yona illemet ]. “a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” from whom David emerged, as he was modest [ makh ] and flawless [ tam ] with everyone. Alternatively, mikhtam that makkato , was complete [ tama ], that was born circumcised. Alternatively, mikhtam just as in his youth made himself small in front of one who was greater than him to learn Torah so too, when he became great

“She sent to her father-in-law, saying: By the man whose these are, am I with child” And let her say to him Rav Zutra bar Tuviyya says Rav says, and some say Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is more amenable for a person to throw himself into a fiery furnace and not humiliate another in public. From where do we From Tamar,

Discern, please, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: With discern informed his father with discern they informed With discern he informed Discern now whether it is your son’s coat With discern they informed him: Discern, please, whose are
please [ na ].” na nothing other a language of request. She said to him: I request of you: Discern the image of your Creator and do not avert your eyes from me.

“And Judah acknowledged them, and said: She is more righteous than I; This is as Rav Ḥanin bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: Joseph, who sanctified the name of Heaven in private merited that one letter from the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, was added to his as it is written: “He appointed it in Joseph [ bihosef ] for a testimony in his name,

Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public, merited that his entire is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, When he confessed and said: “She is more righteous than I,” a Divine Voice went forth and said: You saved Tamar and her two children from the fire. your life, in your merit, I will save three of your children from the fire. who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah
“She is more righteous than I [ mimmenni ].” From where did he know A Divine Voice went forth and said: From Me these hidden emerged,

“And he knew her [ leda’atah ] again no more [ velo yasaf ],” Shmuel the Elder, father-in-law of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, says in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ami: once he knew her he did not desist from her again, it is written here: “ Velo yasaf od leda’atah ,” and it is written there with a great voice and it went on no more [ velo yasaf ]”
