As Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rav, "What is the meaning of the verse, 'For many are the slain she has cast down, and numerous are all her victims' (Proverbs 7:26)?" "For many are the slain she has cast down" — this refers to a Torah scholar who has not reached the level of teaching and instructing. "And numerous are all her victims" — this refers to a Torah scholar who has reached the level of teaching but does not instruct.

sentences.text: אוֹמֵר בֶּן עַזַּאי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְלַמֵּד אֶת וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה — מְלַמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת. תִּיפְלוּת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּאִילּוּ לִמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת.
sentences.human_translation: ben Azzai states: A person is obligated to teach Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who teaches his daughter Torah is teaching her promiscuity. enter your mind promiscuity? Rather, say: as if he taught her promiscuity.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה חׇכְמָה בְּאָדָם — נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ עַרְמוּמִית.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer’s as it is written: “I, wisdom, dwell with cunning” once wisdom enters into a person, cunning enters with it.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer's opinion, as it is written: "I, Wisdom, dwell with Prudence"? Once wisdom enters a person, prudence enters with it.

sentences.text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמַּעֲמִיד עַצְמוֹ עָרוֹם עֲלֵיהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַחׇכְמָה מֵאַיִן תִּמָּצֵא״.
sentences.human_translation: And the Rabbis what do they do with this “I, wisdom, He requires that for that which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The matters of Torah do not endure except in one who stands naked for them, as it is stated: “I, wisdom, dwell with nakedness [ orma ]” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The matters of Torah do not endure except in one who considers himself as one who does not as it is stated: “But wisdom, it can be found in nothingness”
sentences.llm_translation: The sages, what does this "I am wisdom" do for him? He wanted to attribute it to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina. For Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina said: The words of Torah are only established in one who makes himself naked for them, as it is said: "I am wisdom, I dwell with cunning." Rabbi Yochanan said: The words of Torah are only established in one who makes himself as if he is not, as it is said: "And where can wisdom be found?"

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָאָמַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה בְּקַב וְתִיפְלוּת עִמּוֹ, מִתִּשְׁעַת קַבִּין וּפְרִישׁוּת.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: A woman desires What is he saying? This is what is saying: A woman desires to a kav and with it a sexual relationship, than nine kav and abstinence,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "Desires a woman, etc." What is he saying? This is what he is saying: Desires a woman with a kab and prayer with him, from nine kavs and separation.

sentences.text: הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה? כְּגוֹן דְּקָא טָבְעָה אִיתְּתָא בְּנַהֲרָא, וְאָמַר: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאִיסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בַּהּ וְאַצּוֹלַהּ.
sentences.human_translation: He, would say: A foolish man of piety, Who is considered a foolish man of piety? For example, that a woman is drowning in a river, and he says: not proper conduct to look at her and save her.
sentences.llm_translation: He used to say: "A pious fool, like so and so." How is a pious fool defined? For example, if a woman is drowning in a river, and he says: "It is not the way of the world to save her, and I will let her drown."

sentences.text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי רָשָׁע עָרוּם? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּטְעִים דְּבָרָיו לַדַּיָּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵרוֹ. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַנּוֹתֵן דִּינָר לְעָנִי לְהַשְׁלִים לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז — לֹא יִטּוֹל לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי. הָיָה לוֹ מָאתַיִם חָסֵר דִּינָר, אֲפִילּוּ אֶלֶף נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כְּאַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה יִטּוֹל.
sentences.human_translation: Who is considered a conniving wicked person? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is one who presents his statement to the judge before the other litigant comes Rabbi Abbahu says: This one who gives a dinar to a poor man to complete two hundred dinars for him, as we learned One who has two hundred dinars may not collect gleanings, forgotten pe’a , and poor man’s tithe, he has two hundred less dinar, even he is given one thousand at once, he may collect.
sentences.llm_translation: "How are the words of the wicked cunning? Rabbi Yochanan said: This refers to one who prepares his arguments for the judge before his fellow litigant arrives. Rabbi Abahu says: This refers to one who gives a dinar to a poor person to complete for him two hundred zuz. As we learned: If one has two hundred zuz, he should not take gleanings, forgotten sheaves, corner of the field, or tithe for the poor. If he is lacking one dinar of the two hundred, even a thousand people may give it to him at once — he may take it."

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁקָּדְמוּ וּמָכְרוּ בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין — מַה שֶּׁמָּכְרוּ מָכְרוּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Asi Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who provides advice to sell from the small quantity of property as Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: orphans who preemptively sold from a small estate, that which they sold, they sold,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: This is one who gives advice to sell small properties. As Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Orphans who came first and sold small properties - what they sold, they sold.

sentences.text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּתַנְיָא: ״נְכָסַי לְךָ, וְאַחֲרֶיךָ לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְיָרַד הָרִאשׁוֹן וּמָכַר וְאָכַל — הַשֵּׁנִי מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁשִּׁיֵּיר רִאשׁוֹן.
sentences.human_translation: Abaye says: is one who provides advice to sell property in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it is taught My property to you, and after you to so-and-so, and the first entered and sold and consumed the second repossesses from the purchasers, this is the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The second only that which the first left,
sentences.llm_translation: Abaye said: This is one who gives advice to sell assets, like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. As it was taught: "Your assets are for you, and after you for so-and-so," and the first one descended and sold and consumed — the second one takes from the hands of the buyers, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The second one only has what the first one left.

sentences.text: רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זֶה הַמַּכְרִיעַ אֲחֵרִים בְּאוֹרְחוֹתָיו. רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זֶה הַמֵּיקֵל לְעַצְמוֹ וּמַחְמִיר לַאֲחֵרִים. עוּלָּא אָמַר: זֶה
sentences.human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Ḥama Rav Sheshet says: one who persuades others with his ways, Rabbi Zerika Rav Huna says: one who is lenient for himself and strict for others. Ulla says: This
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Chama said Rav Sheshet: This is one who decides for others in his ways. Rabbi Zerika said Rav Huna: This is one who is lenient for himself and strict for others. Ula said: This

sentences.text: שֶׁקָּרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.
sentences.human_translation: who read and learned but did not serve Torah scholars
sentences.llm_translation: "That he read and repeated but did not review the disciples of the sages."

sentences.text: אִתְּמַר: קָרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה עַם הָאָרֶץ. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר. רַבִּי יַנַּאי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה כּוּתִי.
sentences.human_translation: It was stated: read and learned but did not serve Torah scholars, Rabbi Elazar says: This is an ignoramus. Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: This is a boor. Rabbi Yannai says: This is a Samaritan,
sentences.llm_translation: It was stated: He read and repeated but did not serve the Torah scholars, Rabbi Elazar says: Behold, this one is an am ha'aretz. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani says: Behold, this one is a pit. Rabbi Yannai says: Behold, this one is a Samaritan.

sentences.text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה מָגוֹשׁ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רָטֵין מָגוֹשָׁא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר, תָּנֵי תַּנָּא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: This is a sorcerer [ magosh ], Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is reasonable to Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, as people say The sorcerer chants and does not know what he is saying; the tanna teaches and does not know what he is saying.
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya'akov says: "Here is a case of 'magoash'." Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: "It is reasonable like Rav Aḥa bar Ya'akov, for people say: 'He saw a magoash and did not know what he said,' he taught a Mishnah and did not know what he said."

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ? כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ צִיצִית בְּבִגְדוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים וְאֵינוֹ מְגַדְּלָן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ קוֹרֵא וְשׁוֹנֶה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — זֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught: Who is an ignoramus [ am ha’aretz ]? anyone who does not recite Shema morning and evening with its blessings; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: anyone who does not don phylacteries. Ben Azzai says: anyone who does not have ritual fringes on his garment. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef said: anyone who has sons and does not raise them to study Torah. Aḥerim say: Even if one reads and learns but does not serve Torah scholars, he is an ignoramus.
sentences.llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Who is considered an 'Am Ha'aretz (ignorant or unlearned person)? Anyone who does not recite the Shema in the morning and evening prayers with their blessings, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Anyone who does not lay Tefillin. Ben Azzai says: Anyone who does not have Tzitzit on his garment. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef said: Anyone who has children but does not raise them to study Torah. Others say: Even if one reads and repeats but does not serve Torah scholars — this is considered an 'Am Ha'aretz.

sentences.text: קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר, לֹא קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְזָרַעְתִּי אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת בֵּית יְהוּדָה זֶרַע אָדָם וְזֶרַע בְּהֵמָה״.
sentences.human_translation: read but did not learn he is a boor. With regard to did not read and did not learn the verse states: and I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast”
sentences.llm_translation: He read and did not repeat — this is a pitfall; he did not read and did not repeat — the Scripture says about him: "And I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and the seed of beast."

sentences.text: ״יְרָא אֶת ה׳ בְּנִי וָמֶלֶךְ עִם שׁוֹנִים אַל תִּתְעָרָב״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ שֶׁשּׁוֹנִים הֲלָכוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא — שׁוֹנִין בְּחֵטְא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
sentences.human_translation: “My son, fear the Lord and the king; and meddle not with those who are repeating” Rabbi Yitzḥak says: These are who repeatedly learn halakhot Isn’t obvious? lest you say repeatedly sins, and in accordance with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says: Once a person committed a transgression and repeated it, it became permitted for him. teaches us
sentences.llm_translation: "Talmudic text: 'Fear Hashem, my son, and the king, and do not mix with those who are rebellious,' Rabbi Yitzchak said: These are the rebellious laws. It is obvious! What might you say — that they are rebellious in sin, as Rav Huna said: For Rav Huna said: Once a person commits a sin and repeats it, it becomes permitted to him, this is what he teaches us."

sentences.text: תָּנָא: הַתַּנָּאִים — מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם. מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אָמַר רָבִינָא: שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם הֵן? וַהֲלֹא מְיַישְּׁבֵי עוֹלָם הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלִיכוֹת עוֹלָם לוֹ״! אֶלָּא, שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן.
sentences.human_translation: It was taught The tanna’im , are who erode the world. Could enter your mind who erode the world? Ravina says: who issue halakhic rulings based their mishnayot . This is also taught Rabbi Yehoshua said: Are they who erode the world? Aren’t they settling the world, as it is stated: “His ways [ halikhot ] are eternal” Rather, who issue halakhic rulings based their mishnayot .
sentences.llm_translation: Mishna: The Tannaim - they are those who bring to an end the world. "Bringing to an end the world" - is it according to your opinion?! Ravina said: They preserve the halakha from their Mishnah. It was also taught similarly: Rabbi Yehoshua said: Are they those who bring to an end the world? Are they not the inhabitants of the world, as it is stated: "His ways are of old"! Rather, they preserve the halakha from their Mishnah.

sentences.text: אִשָּׁה פְּרוּשָׁה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּתוּלָה צַלְיָינִית, וְאַלְמָנָה שׁוֹבָבִית, וְקָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם.
sentences.human_translation: an abstinent woman The Sages taught: A maiden who prays and a neighborly [ shovavit ] widow and a child whose months were not completed, these are who erode the world.
sentences.llm_translation: A woman who is separated, etc. The Rabbis taught: A virgin who is brazen, and a widow who is wanton, and a minor who has not completed his months - these are considered as those who destroy the world.

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמַדְנוּ יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה, וְקִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה. יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה — דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שַׁמְעַהּ לְהַהִיא בְּתוּלָה דְּנָפְלָה אַאַפַּהּ וְקָאָמְרָה: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, בָּרָאתָ גַּן עֵדֶן וּבָרָאתָ גֵּיהִנָּם, בָּרָאתָ צַדִּיקִים וּבָרָאתָ רְשָׁעִים. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּשְׁלוּ בִּי בְּנֵי אָדָם.
sentences.human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: We learned fear of sin from a maiden, and receiving reward from a widow. fear of sin from a maiden, as Rabbi Yoḥanan heard a certain maiden who fell on her face and she was saying: Master of the Universe, You created the Garden of Eden and You created Gehenna, You created righteous and You created wicked. May it be Your will that men shall not stumble because of me
sentences.llm_translation: I? And did not Rabbi Yochanan say: We have learned fear of sin from a virgin, and receiving reward from a widow. Fear of sin from a virgin - for Rabbi Yochanan heard that virgin who fell and baked it and said: Master of the Universe, You created the Garden of Eden and You created Gehinnom, You created the righteous and You created the wicked. May it be Your will that the sons of man do not cause me to stumble.

sentences.text: קִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה — דְּהָהִיא אַלְמָנָה דַּהֲוַאי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא בְּשִׁיבָבוּתַהּ. כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָת אָתְיָא וּמְצַלָּה בֵּי מִדְרְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, לֹא בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשִׁיבָבוּתִיךְ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, וְלֹא שְׂכַר פְּסִיעוֹת יֵשׁ לִי?
sentences.human_translation: receiving reward from a widow, as a certain widow in whose neighborhood there was a synagogue, every day she went and prayed in the study hall of Rabbi Yoḥanan. said to her: My daughter, not a synagogue in your neighborhood? She said to him: My teacher, don’t I attain a reward the steps
sentences.llm_translation: Received payment from a widow - for she was a widow who was a regular at the synagogue in her neighborhood. Every day she would come and sweep the study hall of Rabbi Yochanan. He said to her: "My daughter, is it not the synagogue in your neighborhood that you should be sweeping?" She said to him: "Rabbi, do I not receive payment for my steps?"

sentences.text: כִּי קָאָמַר, כְּגוֹן יוֹחָנִי בַּת רְטִיבִי.
sentences.human_translation: When it is stated for example, Yoḥani bat Retivi,
sentences.llm_translation: When he said, for example, Yochani Bat Retivi.

sentences.text: מַאי ״קָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו״? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הַמְבַעֵט בְּרַבּוֹתָיו.
sentences.human_translation: What a child whose months were not completed? Here, they interpreted this Torah scholar who scorns his teachers.
sentences.llm_translation: What is "a minor who has not completed his months"? Here it was interpreted: This refers to a Torah scholar who argues with his colleagues.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. ״וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וְאֵינוֹ מוֹרֶה.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abba says: This is a student who has not attained to issue rulings, and he issues rulings as Rabbi Abbahu says Rav Huna says Rav says: What which is written: “For she has cast down many wounded; and a mighty host are all her slain” “For she has cast down [ hippila ] many wounded”; this a Torah scholar who has not attained to issue rulings, and he issues rulings. “And a mighty host [ ve’atzumim ] are all her slain”; this a Torah scholar who has attained to issue rulings, but does not issue rulings
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: This is a student who has not reached the level of teaching and instructing. As Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rav, "What is the meaning of the verse, 'For many are the slain she has cast down, and numerous are all her victims' (Proverbs 7:26)?" "For many are the slain she has cast down" — this refers to a Torah scholar who has not reached the level of teaching and instructing. "And numerous are all her victims" — this refers to a Torah scholar who has reached the level of teaching but does not instruct.

text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
וְתַנְיָא כְּבֵיצָה.
סַבְרוּהָ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּעִיסָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה, וְחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.
מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין,
וּמָר סָבַר: שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין.

אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.

וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּמוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
מָר סָבַר: מוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמָר סָבַר: אָסוּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְכוּ׳.
בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָר סָבַר: דְּרַבָּנַן.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם, נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — כְּגָדוֹל הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״.

רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: כְּקָטָן הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו כׇּל מָה שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״.
רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּסוֹפֵר הַפּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, שֶׁהוּא פּוֹתֵחַ תְּחִילָּה וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו.
בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״, אַמִּילְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא.

וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״ — אַכֹּל מִילְּתָא וּמִילְּתָא, וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה סָבַר: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ״ — דַּאֲמוּר כּוּלְּהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, ״לֵאמֹר״ — דִּפְתַח מֹשֶׁה בְּרֵישָׁא.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — עוֹלָל מוּטָּל עַל בִּרְכֵּי אִמּוֹ, וְתִינוֹק יוֹנֵק מִשְּׁדֵי אִמּוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ אֶת הַשְּׁכִינָה, עוֹלָל הִגְבִּיהַּ צַוָּארוֹ, וְתִינוֹק שָׁמַט דַּד מִפִּיו, וְאָמְרוּ ״זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִפִּי עוֹלְלִים וְיֹנְקִים יִסַּדְתָּ עֹז״.
הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִים שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
וְהָא לָא חֲזוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: כָּרֵס נַעֲשָׂה לָהֶן כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה וְרָאוּ.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן הוּרְקָנוֹס שֶׁלֹּא עָבַד אִיּוֹב כּוּ׳. וְלִיחְזֵי הַאי ״לֹא״, אִי בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף כְּתִיב — ״לֹא״ הוּא, אִי בְּלָמֶד וָיו כְּתִיב — ״לוֹ״ הוּא?
וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, ״לֹא״ הוּא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״בְּכׇל צָרָתָם לֹא צָר״, דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״לֹא״ הוּא?
וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכְתִיב ״וּמַלְאַךְ פָּנָיו הוֹשִׁיעָם״! אֶלָּא לָאו, מַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי.

תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאִיּוֹב, וְנֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאַבְרָהָם, מָה ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאַבְרָהָם — מֵאַהֲבָה, אַף ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאִיּוֹב — מֵאַהֲבָה.
וְאַבְרָהָם גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב ״זֶרַע אַבְרָהָם אֹהֲבִי״.

מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין עוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה לְעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה? אִיכָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה יוֹתֵר מִן הָעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה, שֶׁזֶּה תָּלוּי לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר. וְזֶה תָּלוּי לְאַלְפַּיִם דּוֹר.
הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״לַאֲלָפִים לְאֹהֲבַי וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָי״, וְהָתָם כְּתִיב: ״וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״.
הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיב ״לְאֹהֲבָיו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״!
הַאי לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ וְהַאי לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ.

הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַּלְמִידֵי דַּהֲווֹ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, חַד אָמַר לֵיהּ אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי: ״מָה רַב טוּבְךָ אֲשֶׁר צָפַנְתָּ לִּירֵאֶיךָ״, וְחַד אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי ״וְיִשְׂמְחוּ כׇל חוֹסֵי בָךְ לְעוֹלָם יְרַנֵּנוּ וְיַעְלְצוּ בְךָ אֹהֲבֵי שְׁמֶךָ״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: תַּרְוַיְיכוּ רַבָּנַן צַדִּיקֵי גְּמוּרֵי אַתּוּן. מָר מֵאַהֲבָה, וּמָר מִיִּרְאָה.
הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַמַּיִם
מִי שֶׁקִּינֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִסְתְּרָה, אֲפִילּוּ שָׁמַע מֵעוֹף הַפּוֹרֵחַ — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׂאוּ וְיִתְּנוּ בָּהּ מוֹזְרוֹת בַּלְּבָנָה.
אָמַר עֵד אֶחָד ״אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת״ — לֹא הָיְתָה שׁוֹתָה. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד אֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין אַף לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
חֲמוֹתָהּ וּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ וְצָרָתָהּ וִיבִמְתָּהּ וּבַת בַּעְלָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנוֹת. וְלֹא לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתֶּה.

שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין: וּמָה אִם עֵדוּת רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינָהּ מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם, עֵדוּת אַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַיֵּים בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם?
תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, כׇּל עֵדוּת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לְעֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה מֵעַתָּה: וּמָה אִם

The Sages taught: On that same day Rabbi Akiva taught at the time that the Jewish people ascended from the sea they set their eyes on reciting a song And how did they recite song? as an adult man reciting hallel and recite after him the chapter headings Moses said: “I will sing unto the Lord” and said “I will sing unto the Lord.” Moses said: “For He is highly exalted” and they said “I will sing unto the Lord.”

And Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, holds “saying” to every single word, And Rabbi Neḥemya holds “and they said” that everyone recited together, “saying” that Moses began first;

The Sages taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili taught: At the time that the Jewish people ascended from the sea they resolved to sing And how did they recite a baby lying on his mother’s lap or an infant nursing from his mother’s breasts, once they saw the Divine Presence, the baby straightened his neck and the infant dropped the breast from his mouth, and they recited: “This is my God and I will glorify Him” As it is stated: “Out of the mouths of babies and sucklings You have founded strength”

“In full assemblies, bless God, the Lord, you that are from the source of Israel”

On that same day Rabbi Yehoshua ben Hyrcanus taught that Job served only Let us see whether this lo is written lamed alef , is: not whether it is written lamed vav , is: in Him.
But anywhere that is written lamed alef , is: Not? If that is so, “In all their affliction He was [ lo ] afflicted” where is written lamed alef , so too, does it Not,
And if you would say indeed but isn’t it written “And the angel of His Presence saved them,” Rather, is it not indicates this and indicates that?

It is taught Rabbi Meir says: It is stated with regard to Job “God-fearing” and it is stated with regard to Abraham “God-fearing” Just as “God-fearing,” which is stated with regard to Abraham, out of love, so too, “God-fearing” that is stated with regard to Job out of love.
And Abraham himself, from where do we As it is written: “The offspring of Abraham who loved Me”

What is there between one who performs out of love and one who performs out of fear? There is that which is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Greater is the one who performs out of love than the one who performs out of fear, as this endure for one thousand generations, and that endure for two thousand generations.
here it is written: “And showing mercy unto thousands of generations of those who love Me and keep My commandments” and there it is written: and keep His commandments for a thousand generations”
there also, it is written: with those who love Him and keep His commandments for a thousand generations”

Sage, out of love, and Sage, out of fear.

With what do they argue? One Master holds: the boundaries of the Torah, and the other Master holds: of the Rabbis.

The Rabbis taught: On that day, Rabbi Akiva expounded: At the moment when the Israelites ascended from the sea, they gave their eyes to say a song. And how did they say the song? "As the great one who recites the Hallel, and they respond after him chapter heads." Moses said, "I will sing to the Lord," and they say, "I will sing to the Lord." Moses said, "For exalted, exalted," and they say, "I will sing to the Lord."

Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, says: Like a minor who reads the Hallel, and they respond after him everything that he says. Moses said, "I will sing to the Lord," and they say, "I will sing to the Lord." Moses said, "For exalted, exalted," and they say, "For exalted, exalted."
Rabbi Nechemiah says: Like a scribe who reads aloud in the synagogue, who begins first and they respond after him.
In what do they disagree? — Rabbi Akiva holds: "to say," is the primary point.

Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, holds: "to say" — eat each word and each word. And Rabbi Nechemiah holds: "and they said" — that they said all of them together, "to say" — for Moses began at the beginning.

The Rabbis taught: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean expounded: When the Israelites ascended from the sea, they directed their eyes to say a song. And how did they say the song? — A suckling babe on his mother's knees, and a nursing child from his mother's breasts. As soon as they saw the Divine Presence, the babe raised his neck, and the child released the breast from his mouth, and they said, "This is my God, and I will glorify Him," as it is stated: "Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings You have established strength."
Talmudic text: Rabbi Meir would say: From where do we derive that even fetuses in their mother's womb recited a song? As it is stated: (
"In the assemblies bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel."
The Gemara asks: But did they not see? Rabbi Tanhum said: A miracle occurred for them like the spectacle of a lantern that shines and they saw.
In it on the day Rabbi Yehoshua ben Hurkanos expounded that Job did not sin. And regarding this "לֹא," if written with an Aleph, it is "לֹא," if written with a Vav, it is "לוֹ"?
And all the place where it is written with a "lamed aleph," "lo" is it? Rather from now on "bekol tzaratam lo tzar," as it is written with a "lamed aleph," so too is it that "lo" is it?
And if you will say so, it is stated "and an angel of His presence saved them"! Rather, no, understand it this way and understand it this way.

It was taught: Rabbi Meir says: It is stated "he fears God" regarding Job, and it is stated "he fears God" regarding Abraham. Just as the "fears God" said of Abraham is from love, so too the "fears God" said of Job is from love.
And Abraham, his body, from where? - as it is written, "The offspring of Abraham, My beloved."

Talmudic text: What is the difference between one who acts out of love and one who acts out of fear? There is the one that it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Greater is one who acts out of love more than one who acts out of fear, for this one is dependent on a thousand generations. And this one is dependent on two thousand generations.

Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: Here it is written: "To thousands of those who love Me and keep My commandments," and there it is written: "And to those who keep His commandments to a thousand generations."
There, it is written: "to those who love Him and keep His commandments to a thousand generations"!
This one is for his benefit, and this one is for his benefit.

Behold, there were two disciples who were sitting before Rava. One said to him, "Read in your dreams: 'How great is Your goodness that You have hidden for those who fear You.'" And the other said to him, "Read in your dreams: 'Let all who take refuge in You rejoice; let them ever shout for joy, and may You shelter them; let those who love Your name exult in You.'" He said to them: "You are truly righteous scholars. One loves out of love, and one loves out of fear."
We will return to you as the water.

Rabbi Yehoshua says: Until they lift and place in it (the basket) the straps in the moon.
He said, one witness, "I saw her become impure" - she did not drink. And not only that, but even a slave or even a maidservant - these are believed even to disqualify her from her marriage contract.

Her mother-in-law, and her daughter-in-law, and her rival, and her co-wife, and her husband's daughter - these are considered trustworthy. And not to disqualify her from her document, but that she should not drink.

sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, holds “saying” to every single word, And Rabbi Neḥemya holds “and they said” that everyone recited together, “saying” that Moses began first;
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, holds: "to say" — eat each word and each word. And Rabbi Nechemiah holds: "and they said" — that they said all of them together, "to say" — for Moses began at the beginning.

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — עוֹלָל מוּטָּל עַל בִּרְכֵּי אִמּוֹ, וְתִינוֹק יוֹנֵק מִשְּׁדֵי אִמּוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ אֶת הַשְּׁכִינָה, עוֹלָל הִגְבִּיהַּ צַוָּארוֹ, וְתִינוֹק שָׁמַט דַּד מִפִּיו, וְאָמְרוּ ״זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִפִּי עוֹלְלִים וְיֹנְקִים יִסַּדְתָּ עֹז״.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili taught: At the time that the Jewish people ascended from the sea they resolved to sing And how did they recite a baby lying on his mother’s lap or an infant nursing from his mother’s breasts, once they saw the Divine Presence, the baby straightened his neck and the infant dropped the breast from his mouth, and they recited: “This is my God and I will glorify Him” As it is stated: “Out of the mouths of babies and sucklings You have founded strength”
sentences.llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean expounded: When the Israelites ascended from the sea, they directed their eyes to say a song. And how did they say the song? — A suckling babe on his mother's knees, and a nursing child from his mother's breasts. As soon as they saw the Divine Presence, the babe raised his neck, and the child released the breast from his mouth, and they said, "This is my God, and I will glorify Him," as it is stated: "Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings You have established strength."

sentences.text: הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִים שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Meir would say: From where that even fetuses in their mother’s womb recited song As it is stated:
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Meir would say: From where do we derive that even fetuses in their mother's womb recited a song? As it is stated: (

sentences.text: ״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
sentences.human_translation: “In full assemblies, bless God, the Lord, you that are from the source of Israel”
sentences.llm_translation: "In the assemblies bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel."

sentences.text: וְהָא לָא חֲזוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: כָּרֵס נַעֲשָׂה לָהֶן כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה וְרָאוּ.
sentences.human_translation: But could not see, Rabbi Tanḥum says: stomach was transformed for them like luminous crystal [ aspaklarya ], and they saw
sentences.llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But did they not see? Rabbi Tanhum said: A miracle occurred for them like the spectacle of a lantern that shines and they saw.

sentences.text: בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן הוּרְקָנוֹס שֶׁלֹּא עָבַד אִיּוֹב כּוּ׳. וְלִיחְזֵי הַאי ״לֹא״, אִי בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף כְּתִיב — ״לֹא״ הוּא, אִי בְּלָמֶד וָיו כְּתִיב — ״לוֹ״ הוּא?
sentences.human_translation: On that same day Rabbi Yehoshua ben Hyrcanus taught that Job served only Let us see whether this lo is written lamed alef , is: not whether it is written lamed vav , is: in Him.
sentences.llm_translation: In it on the day Rabbi Yehoshua ben Hurkanos expounded that Job did not sin. And regarding this "לֹא," if written with an Aleph, it is "לֹא," if written with a Vav, it is "לוֹ"?

sentences.text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, ״לֹא״ הוּא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״בְּכׇל צָרָתָם לֹא צָר״, דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״לֹא״ הוּא?
sentences.human_translation: But anywhere that is written lamed alef , is: Not? If that is so, “In all their affliction He was [ lo ] afflicted” where is written lamed alef , so too, does it Not,
sentences.llm_translation: And all the place where it is written with a "lamed aleph," "lo" is it? Rather from now on "bekol tzaratam lo tzar," as it is written with a "lamed aleph," so too is it that "lo" is it?

sentences.text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכְתִיב ״וּמַלְאַךְ פָּנָיו הוֹשִׁיעָם״! אֶלָּא לָאו, מַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי.
sentences.human_translation: And if you would say indeed but isn’t it written “And the angel of His Presence saved them,” Rather, is it not indicates this and indicates that?
sentences.llm_translation: And if you will say so, it is stated "and an angel of His presence saved them"! Rather, no, understand it this way and understand it this way.

sentences.text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאִיּוֹב, וְנֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאַבְרָהָם, מָה ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאַבְרָהָם — מֵאַהֲבָה, אַף ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאִיּוֹב — מֵאַהֲבָה.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir says: It is stated with regard to Job “God-fearing” and it is stated with regard to Abraham “God-fearing” Just as “God-fearing,” which is stated with regard to Abraham, out of love, so too, “God-fearing” that is stated with regard to Job out of love.
sentences.llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir says: It is stated "he fears God" regarding Job, and it is stated "he fears God" regarding Abraham. Just as the "fears God" said of Abraham is from love, so too the "fears God" said of Job is from love.

sentences.text: וְאַבְרָהָם גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב ״זֶרַע אַבְרָהָם אֹהֲבִי״.
sentences.human_translation: And Abraham himself, from where do we As it is written: “The offspring of Abraham who loved Me”
sentences.llm_translation: And Abraham, his body, from where? - as it is written, "The offspring of Abraham, My beloved."

sentences.text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין עוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה לְעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה? אִיכָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה יוֹתֵר מִן הָעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה, שֶׁזֶּה תָּלוּי לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר. וְזֶה תָּלוּי לְאַלְפַּיִם דּוֹר.
sentences.human_translation: What is there between one who performs out of love and one who performs out of fear? There is that which is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Greater is the one who performs out of love than the one who performs out of fear, as this endure for one thousand generations, and that endure for two thousand generations.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the difference between one who acts out of love and one who acts out of fear? There is the one that it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Greater is one who acts out of love more than one who acts out of fear, for this one is dependent on a thousand generations. And this one is dependent on two thousand generations.

sentences.text: הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״לַאֲלָפִים לְאֹהֲבַי וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָי״, וְהָתָם כְּתִיב: ״וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״.
sentences.human_translation: here it is written: “And showing mercy unto thousands of generations of those who love Me and keep My commandments” and there it is written: and keep His commandments for a thousand generations”
sentences.llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: Here it is written: "To thousands of those who love Me and keep My commandments," and there it is written: "And to those who keep His commandments to a thousand generations."

sentences.text: הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיב ״לְאֹהֲבָיו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״!
sentences.human_translation: there also, it is written: with those who love Him and keep His commandments for a thousand generations”
sentences.llm_translation: There, it is written: "to those who love Him and keep His commandments to a thousand generations"!

sentences.text: הַאי לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ וְהַאי לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ.
sentences.human_translation: That to that which is adjacent to it. And this to that which is adjacent to it:
sentences.llm_translation: This one is for his benefit, and this one is for his benefit.

sentences.text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַּלְמִידֵי דַּהֲווֹ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, חַד אָמַר לֵיהּ אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי: ״מָה רַב טוּבְךָ אֲשֶׁר צָפַנְתָּ לִּירֵאֶיךָ״, וְחַד אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי ״וְיִשְׂמְחוּ כׇל חוֹסֵי בָךְ לְעוֹלָם יְרַנֵּנוּ וְיַעְלְצוּ בְךָ אֹהֲבֵי שְׁמֶךָ״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: תַּרְוַיְיכוּ רַבָּנַן צַדִּיקֵי גְּמוּרֵי אַתּוּן. מָר מֵאַהֲבָה, וּמָר מִיִּרְאָה.
sentences.human_translation: these two students who were sitting before Rava, one said to him: It was read to me in my dream: “How abundant is Your goodness, which You have laid up for those who fear You” And one said to It was read to me in my dream: “So shall all those who take refuge in You rejoice; they will forever shout for joy, let them also who love Your name exult in You” said to them: You are both completely righteous Sages. Sage, out of love, and Sage, out of fear.
sentences.llm_translation: Behold, there were two disciples who were sitting before Rava. One said to him, "Read in your dreams: 'How great is Your goodness that You have hidden for those who fear You.'" And the other said to him, "Read in your dreams: 'Let all who take refuge in You rejoice; let them ever shout for joy, and may You shelter them; let those who love Your name exult in You.'" He said to them: "You are truly righteous scholars. One loves out of love, and one loves out of fear."

sentences.text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַמַּיִם
sentences.llm_translation: We will return to you as the water.

sentences.text: מִי שֶׁקִּינֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִסְתְּרָה, אֲפִילּוּ שָׁמַע מֵעוֹף הַפּוֹרֵחַ — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
sentences.human_translation: one who warned his wife and she secluded herself even if he heard from a flying bird, he must divorce grant her marriage contract the statement of Rabbi Eliezer,
sentences.llm_translation: One who is jealous of his wife and she concealed herself, even if he heard from a bird in flight - he should divorce her and give her a written document, the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׂאוּ וְיִתְּנוּ בָּהּ מוֹזְרוֹת בַּלְּבָנָה.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: until spin by light of the moon discuss her
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Until they lift and place in it (the basket) the straps in the moon.

sentences.text: אָמַר עֵד אֶחָד ״אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת״ — לֹא הָיְתָה שׁוֹתָה. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד אֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין אַף לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: one witness said: I saw that she became defiled she does not drink And furthermore, even a slave or a maidservant, they are deemed credible even to disqualifies her from her marriage contract
sentences.llm_translation: He said, one witness, "I saw her become impure" - she did not drink. And not only that, but even a slave or even a maidservant - these are believed even to disqualify her from her marriage contract.

sentences.text: חֲמוֹתָהּ וּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ וְצָרָתָהּ וִיבִמְתָּהּ וּבַת בַּעְלָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנוֹת. וְלֹא לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתֶּה.
sentences.human_translation: Her mother-in-law, and her mother in-law’s daughter, and her rival wife, and her yevama , and her husband’s daughter, They are deemed credible but not to disqualify her from her marriage contract; rather, not drink
sentences.llm_translation: Her mother-in-law, and her daughter-in-law, and her rival, and her co-wife, and her husband's daughter - these are considered trustworthy. And not to disqualify her from her document, but that she should not drink.

sentences.text: שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין: וּמָה אִם עֵדוּת רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינָהּ מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם, עֵדוּת אַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַיֵּים בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם?
sentences.human_translation: as, by right, should have been And just as if the first testimony which does not forbid her an irrevocable prohibition, is not established with fewer than two the final testimony which forbids her an irrevocable prohibition, is it not logical that it not be established with fewer than two
sentences.llm_translation: In the case of a judgment: And what if the first testimony, which does not render it a perpetual prohibition - it is not upheld with less than two witnesses, the last testimony, which renders it a perpetual prohibition - is it not a judgment that is not upheld with less than two witnesses?

sentences.text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, כׇּל עֵדוּת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: the verse states: “And there be no witness against her” any that there is against her
sentences.llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And there is no witness in it," any testimony that contains within it.

sentences.text: וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לְעֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה מֵעַתָּה: וּמָה אִם
sentences.human_translation: And from now an a fortiori with regard to the first testimony And just as if
sentences.llm_translation: And light and heavy for the testimony of the first from now: and what if

text: שֶׁמְּבַזְבְּזִין דִּין אֲבִיהֶם לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא. אוֹמְרִים לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מֵאַחַר שֶׁאַתָּה עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵהֶן, לָמָה הִקְהֵיתָה שִׁינֵּיהֶם בָּם?

אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד, הָיוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מוֹכְרֵי רְבָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁיתָה ה׳ מוֹרָה לָהֶם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבַקּוּק, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִתְכַּסִּים בְּטַלִּית אַחַת וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ שָׁמַעְתִּי שִׁמְעֲךָ יָרֵאתִי ה׳ פׇּעׇלְךָ בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים חַיֵּיהוּ״. אַל תִּקְרָא ״בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים״, אֶלָּא ״בְּקֵרוּב שְׁנַיִם״.

וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַמְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין בֵּינֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף בָּאֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי הֵמָּה הֹלְכִים הָלוֹךְ וְדַבֵּר וְהִנֵּה רֶכֶב אֵשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא דִּיבּוּר, הָא לֵיכָּא דִּיבּוּר — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף.

וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַדָּרִין בְּעִיר אַחַת וְאֵין נוֹחִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה — אֶחָד מֵת וְאֶחָד גּוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָנֻס שָׁמָּה רוֹצֵחַ אֲשֶׁר יִרְצַח אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בִּבְלִי דַעַת״, וְאֵין דַּעַת אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִדְמוּ עַמִּי מִבְּלִי הַדָּעַת״.

אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה מִתּוֹךְ הַדְּחָק — תְּפִלָּתוֹ נִשְׁמַעַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַם בְּצִיּוֹן יֵשֵׁב בִּירוּשָׁלִָם בָּכוֹ לֹא תִבְכֶּה חָנוֹן יׇחְנְךָ לְקוֹל זַעֲקֶךָ כְּשׇׁמְעָתוֹ עָנָךְ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְנָתַן ה׳ לָכֶם לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ״.

רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ מִזִּיו שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינֶיךָ רֹאוֹת אֶת מוֹרֶיךָ״. רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אַף אֵין הַפַּרְגּוֹד נִנְעָל בְּפָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִכָּנֵף עוֹד מוֹרֶיךָ״.

רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵין וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם מְרוּבָּה קִלְלָתוֹ מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן עֶרֶב וּבָעֶרֶב תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן בֹּקֶר״, הֵי בֹּקֶר? אִילֵימָא בֹּקֶר דְּלִמְחַר, מִי יָדַע מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא דַּחֲלֵיף.

וְאֶלָּא, עָלְמָא אַמַּאי קָא מִקַּיַּים? אַקְּדוּשָּׁה דְסִידְרָא, וְאַ״יְּהֵא שְׁמֵיהּ רַבָּא״ דְּאַגַּדְתָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶרֶץ עֵיפָתָה כְּמוֹ אֹפֶל צַלְמָוֶת וְלֹא סְדָרִים״, הָא יֵשׁ סְדָרִים — תּוֹפִיעַ מֵאוֹפֶל.
וְלֹא יָרַד טַל לִבְרָכָה וְנִיטַּל טַעַם פֵּירוֹת וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: טׇהֳרָה — בִּטְּלָה טַעַם וָרֵיחַ, מַעֲשֵׂר — בִּיטֵּל שׁוֹמֶן דָּגָן.

רַב הוּנָא אַשְׁכַּח תּוֹמַרְתָּא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא, שַׁקְלַהּ, כַּרְכַהּ בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ. אֲתָא רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹרְחִינָא רֵיחָא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, טׇהֳרָה יֵשׁ בְּךָ. יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ, שַׁקְלַהּ, יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, שִׂמַּחְתָּ אֶת לִבִּי, וְהִקְהֵיתָה אֶת שִׁינַּי. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַחֲמֵי דְּאַבָּא — אַבְּנֵי, רַחֲמֵי דִּבְנֵי — אַבְּנֵי דְּהָווּ לֵיהּ.

רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אִיטַּפַּל בֵּיהּ בְּרַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר בְּרַתֵּיה. כִּי גְדַל אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַשְׁקְיַין מַיָּא. אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו בְּרָיךְ אֲנָא. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַבִּי רַבִּי, בַּר בְּרַתָּךְ אֲנָא.
מַתְנִי׳ בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל אַסְפַּסְיָינוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת חֲתָנִים וְעַל הָאִירוּס.
בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל טִיטוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת כַּלּוֹת, וְשֶׁלֹּא יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ יְווֹנִית.
בְּפוּלְמוּס הָאַחֲרוֹן גָּזְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא תֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּ שֶׁתֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר.

מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּטְלוּ מוֹשְׁלֵי מְשָׁלִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן עַזַּאי בָּטְלוּ הַשַּׁקְדָנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן זוֹמָא בָּטְלוּ הַדַּרְשָׁנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא בָּטְלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קְטֹנְתָּא פָּסְקוּ חֲסִידִים. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״קְטֹנְתָּא״ — שֶׁהָיָה קְטֹנְתָּא שֶׁל חֲסִידִים.

מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי בָּטַל זִיו הַחׇכְמָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה, וּמֵתָה טׇהֳרָה וּפְרִישׁוּת. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּאָבִי בָּטְלָה זִיו הַכְּהוּנָּה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי בָּטְלָ[ה] עֲנָוָה וְיִרְאַת חֵטְא.

[ גְּמָ׳ ] תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן יָאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בּוֹשׁוּ חֲבֵרִים וּבְנֵי חוֹרִין, וְחָפוּ רֹאשָׁם, וְנִדַּלְדְּלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה, וְגָבְרוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעַ וּבַעֲלֵי לָשׁוֹן, וְאֵין דּוֹרֵשׁ וְאֵין מְבַקֵּשׁ וְאֵין שׁוֹאֵל,
עַל מִי לָנוּ לְהִשָּׁעֵן עַל אָבִינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ שָׁרוֹ חַכִּימַיָּא לְמֶהֱוֵי כְּסָפְרַיָּא, וְסָפְרַיָּא כְּחַזָּנַיָּא, וְחַזָּנַיָּא כְּעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא, וְעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא
human_translation: who plunder, their fathers’ future judgment. say before Him: Master of the Universe, because You were destined to exact punishment from why did You blunt their teeth with

Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: If it were not for the prayer of David all Israel would be sellers of fat [ revav ], as it is stated: “Place for them mastery, O Lord” And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: If it were not for the prayer of Habakkuk, two Torah scholars would have to cover themselves with a single cloak and engage in Torah study as it is stated: “Lord, I heard Your report and was afraid; O Lord, revive Your work in the midst of the years” Do not read: “In the midst [ bekerev ] of the years [ shanim ],” but in the closeness [ bikrov ] of two [ shenayim ].

And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: two Torah scholars who are walking along the way and there are no words of Torah between them, they are deserving of being burned in fire. As it is stated “And it was as they walked along, talking, that behold, there appeared a chariot of fire The reason that there was speech but if there had been no speech, they deserving of being burned

And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: two Torah scholars who reside in the same city and they are not pleasant to each other with regard to halakha , one die and one exiled. As is stated: “That the manslayer might flee there, who slays his neighbor without knowledge” and “knowledge” nothing other Torah, as it is stated: “My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge”

Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: any Torah scholar who engages in Torah while experiencing the pressure his prayer is listened to, as it is stated: “For, O people that dwells in Zion at Jerusalem, you shall weep no more; He will surely be gracious to you at the voice of your cry. When He shall hear, He will answer you” and after it is written: “And the Lord shall give you sparse bread and scant water”

Rabbi Abbahu says: is satiated with the glory of the Divine Presence, as it is stated “And your eyes shall behold your Teacher.” Rabbi Aḥa, son of Ḥanina, said: Even the partition pargod is not locked before him, as it is stated: “And your Teacher shall not hide Himself anymore”

Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, there is no Rava says: Each and every day is more cursed than the previous one, as it is stated “In the morning you will say, would that it were evening, and in the evening you will say, would that it were morning” which morning If we say the following morning, does he know what will be Rather, that has passed;

But why does the world exist? By the sanctification that order and Let His great name of aggada . As it is stated: “A land of thick darkness, as darkness itself; a land of the shadow of death, without any order” Therefore, there are orders shall appear from the darkness.

dew has not descended for a blessing, and the taste has been removed from fruit. It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: purity has removed the taste and the aroma; tithes have removed the fat of grain.

Rav Huna found a fragrant date. He took it and wrapped it in his shawl. Rabba, his son, came said to him: I smell the aroma of a fragrant said to him: My son, there is purity in you, He gave it to him. Meanwhile, Abba, son, arrived. took gave it to said to My son, you have made my heart rejoice and you have blunted my teeth, This that people say: The love of a father is for the sons; the love of the sons is for their own sons,

Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov took care of Rav Ya’akov, the son of his daughter, When grew up, said to him: Give me water to drink. He said to him: I am not your son, And this that people say: Raise, raise I am the son of your daughter,
In the war [ pulemus ] of Vespasian decreed upon the crowns of bridegrooms, and upon the drums,
In the war of Titus they decreed upon the crowns of brides, and that a person should not teach his son Greek.
In the last war, they decreed that a bride may not go out in a palanquin inside the city, but our Sages permitted a bride to go out in a palanquin inside the city,

From when Rabbi Meir died, those who relate parables ceased; from when ben Azzai died, the diligent ceased; from when ben Zoma died, the exegetists ceased; from when Rabbi Akiva died, the honor of the Torah ceased; from when Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa died, the men of action ceased; from when Rabbi Yosei the Small died, the pious were no more. And why was he called the Small? Because he was the smallest of the pious,

From when Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai died, the glory of wisdom ceased; from when Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and asceticism died. From when Rabbi Yishmael ben Pavi died, the glory of the priesthood ceased; from when Rabbi died, humility and fear of sin ceased.

The Sages taught: Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir says: From when the Temple was destroyed, the ḥaverim and free men were ashamed, and their heads were covered and men of action dwindled, and violent and smooth-talking men gained the upper hand, and none seek, and none ask, and none inquire
Upon whom for us to rely? upon our Father in Heaven.

Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the day the Temple was destroyed, Scholars have begun to become like scribes and scribes have become like beadles, and beadles have become like ignoramuses, and ignoramuses
llm_translation: "They degrade the judgment of their Father in Heaven. They say before Him: Master of the Universe, since You are destined to avenge Yourself from them, why did You grind their teeth in them?"

Said Rabbi Ilai Bar Yeverechia: Were it not for the prayer of David, all of Israel would have been sold for a quarter, as it is stated: "You have set, O Lord, a teaching for them." And Rabbi Ilai Bar Yeverechia said: Were it not for the prayer of Habakkuk, two Torah scholars would cover themselves with one cloak and engage in Torah study, as it is stated: "O Lord, I have heard the report of You, I am awed, O Lord, by Your deed; in the course of the years, revive it." Do not read "in the course of the years," but rather "in the midst of the years."

And Rabbi Ilai the son of Yevarkhya said: Two Torah scholars walking on the road, and there are no words of Torah between them — they are fit to be burned with fire, as it is stated: "And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, etc." The reason for speech is present, but if there is no speech — they are fit to be burned.

And said Rabbi Ilai son of Yevorkya: Two students of sages who reside in one city and do not find rest with each other in matters of halakha - one dies and one goes into exile, as it is said: "To a city of refuge shall the manslayer flee, he who kills his fellow unintentionally," and there is no knowledge except for Torah, as it is said: "My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge."

Said Rabbi Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya: Every Torah scholar who studies Torah under duress - his prayer is heard, as it is stated: "For a people shall dwell in Zion, in Jerusalem; you shall weep no more. He will be very gracious to you at the sound of your cry; when He hears it, He will answer you." And it is written further: "And the Lord will give you bread in adversity and water in oppression."

Rabbi Abbahu says: We swear him from the splendor of the Divine Presence, as it is said: "And your eyes shall see your teachers." Rabbi Acha bar Chanina says: Even the Paragog is not locked in front of him, as it is said: "And your teachers shall not be hidden anymore."

Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: "From the day the Temple was destroyed, there is no..." Rava said: "Every day his curse is greater than his fellow's, as it is stated: 'In the morning you will say, 'If only it were evening!' and in the evening you will say, 'If only it were morning!'' Is it morning? If you say it is morning, perhaps tomorrow, who knows what will happen? Rather, it is a cycle."

Talmudic text: And rather, why is the world established? The sanctity of order, and "And His name shall be called Raba" of Aggadta, as it is said: "A land of darkness, as darkness itself, and of the shadow of death, without any order," but there is order — it emerges from darkness.

The text reads as follows: "And dew did not descend for blessing, and the taste of fruits was removed, etc. It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Purity - it nullified the taste and the smell, tithes - it nullified the oil of the grain."

Rav Huna found a myrtle branch, he took it, tied it with its leaves. Rabba, his son, came, said to him: I smell the fragrance of myrtle. He said to him: My son, you have purity. He gave it to him. Later, Abba, his father, came, took it, gave it to him. He said to him: My son, you have gladdened my heart, and you have whitened my teeth. This is what people say: The mercies of a father - stones, the mercies of a son - stones that were his.

Rav Ahah son of Jacob prayed in the presence of Rav Jacob son of his daughter. When he grew up, he said to him: "Give me water." He said to him: "I am not a well." And this is what people say: "My master, my master, I am your son's son."
The Mishnah: In the city of Pumbedita of Aspasyanus, they decreed regarding the crowns of grooms and regarding betrothal.
In the Pulumus of Titus they decreed on bridal crowns, and so that a person should not teach his son Greek.
In Pulumus the latter, they decreed that the bride shall not go out with a veil within the city, and our Rabbis permitted that the bride may go out with a veil within the city.

From the death of Rabbi Meir, the interpreters of parables ceased. From the death of Ben Azzai, the almond trees ceased. From the death of Ben Zoma, the expounders ceased. From the death of Rabbi Akiva, the honor of the Torah ceased. From the death of Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa, the men of deeds ceased. From the death of Rabbi Yosei K'tanta, the pious ceased. And why was he called "K'tanta" - because he was the smallest among the pious.

From when Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai died, the splendor of wisdom ceased. From when Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and separation ceased. From when Rabbi Yishmael ben Piavi died, the radiance of the priesthood ceased. From when Rabbi died, humility and fear of sin ceased.

G'ma The Rabbis taught: Rabbi Pinchas ben Yair says: When the Temple was destroyed, friends and free men were put to shame, their heads were covered, the men of action were shaken, the strong of arm and the eloquent prevailed, and no one inquired, and no one sought, and no one asked.
On whom shall we rely? On our Father in Heaven.

Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the day the Temple was destroyed, the wise scholars have become like scribes, the scribes like synagogue attendants, the synagogue attendants like common people, and the common people like donkeys.

sentences.text: שֶׁמְּבַזְבְּזִין דִּין אֲבִיהֶם לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא. אוֹמְרִים לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מֵאַחַר שֶׁאַתָּה עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵהֶן, לָמָה הִקְהֵיתָה שִׁינֵּיהֶם בָּם?
sentences.human_translation: who plunder, their fathers’ future judgment. say before Him: Master of the Universe, because You were destined to exact punishment from why did You blunt their teeth with
sentences.llm_translation: "They degrade the judgment of their Father in Heaven. They say before Him: Master of the Universe, since You are destined to avenge Yourself from them, why did You grind their teeth in them?"

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד, הָיוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מוֹכְרֵי רְבָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁיתָה ה׳ מוֹרָה לָהֶם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבַקּוּק, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִתְכַּסִּים בְּטַלִּית אַחַת וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ שָׁמַעְתִּי שִׁמְעֲךָ יָרֵאתִי ה׳ פׇּעׇלְךָ בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים חַיֵּיהוּ״. אַל תִּקְרָא ״בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים״, אֶלָּא ״בְּקֵרוּב שְׁנַיִם״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: If it were not for the prayer of David all Israel would be sellers of fat [ revav ], as it is stated: “Place for them mastery, O Lord” And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: If it were not for the prayer of Habakkuk, two Torah scholars would have to cover themselves with a single cloak and engage in Torah study as it is stated: “Lord, I heard Your report and was afraid; O Lord, revive Your work in the midst of the years” Do not read: “In the midst [ bekerev ] of the years [ shanim ],” but in the closeness [ bikrov ] of two [ shenayim ].
sentences.llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ilai Bar Yeverechia: Were it not for the prayer of David, all of Israel would have been sold for a quarter, as it is stated: "You have set, O Lord, a teaching for them." And Rabbi Ilai Bar Yeverechia said: Were it not for the prayer of Habakkuk, two Torah scholars would cover themselves with one cloak and engage in Torah study, as it is stated: "O Lord, I have heard the report of You, I am awed, O Lord, by Your deed; in the course of the years, revive it." Do not read "in the course of the years," but rather "in the midst of the years."

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַמְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין בֵּינֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף בָּאֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי הֵמָּה הֹלְכִים הָלוֹךְ וְדַבֵּר וְהִנֵּה רֶכֶב אֵשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא דִּיבּוּר, הָא לֵיכָּא דִּיבּוּר — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: two Torah scholars who are walking along the way and there are no words of Torah between them, they are deserving of being burned in fire. As it is stated “And it was as they walked along, talking, that behold, there appeared a chariot of fire The reason that there was speech but if there had been no speech, they deserving of being burned
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Ilai the son of Yevarkhya said: Two Torah scholars walking on the road, and there are no words of Torah between them — they are fit to be burned with fire, as it is stated: "And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, etc." The reason for speech is present, but if there is no speech — they are fit to be burned.

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַדָּרִין בְּעִיר אַחַת וְאֵין נוֹחִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה — אֶחָד מֵת וְאֶחָד גּוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָנֻס שָׁמָּה רוֹצֵחַ אֲשֶׁר יִרְצַח אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בִּבְלִי דַעַת״, וְאֵין דַּעַת אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִדְמוּ עַמִּי מִבְּלִי הַדָּעַת״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: two Torah scholars who reside in the same city and they are not pleasant to each other with regard to halakha , one die and one exiled. As is stated: “That the manslayer might flee there, who slays his neighbor without knowledge” and “knowledge” nothing other Torah, as it is stated: “My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge”
sentences.llm_translation: And said Rabbi Ilai son of Yevorkya: Two students of sages who reside in one city and do not find rest with each other in matters of halakha - one dies and one goes into exile, as it is said: "To a city of refuge shall the manslayer flee, he who kills his fellow unintentionally," and there is no knowledge except for Torah, as it is said: "My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge."

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה מִתּוֹךְ הַדְּחָק — תְּפִלָּתוֹ נִשְׁמַעַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַם בְּצִיּוֹן יֵשֵׁב בִּירוּשָׁלִָם בָּכוֹ לֹא תִבְכֶּה חָנוֹן יׇחְנְךָ לְקוֹל זַעֲקֶךָ כְּשׇׁמְעָתוֹ עָנָךְ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְנָתַן ה׳ לָכֶם לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: any Torah scholar who engages in Torah while experiencing the pressure his prayer is listened to, as it is stated: “For, O people that dwells in Zion at Jerusalem, you shall weep no more; He will surely be gracious to you at the voice of your cry. When He shall hear, He will answer you” and after it is written: “And the Lord shall give you sparse bread and scant water”
sentences.llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya: Every Torah scholar who studies Torah under duress - his prayer is heard, as it is stated: "For a people shall dwell in Zion, in Jerusalem; you shall weep no more. He will be very gracious to you at the sound of your cry; when He hears it, He will answer you." And it is written further: "And the Lord will give you bread in adversity and water in oppression."

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ מִזִּיו שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינֶיךָ רֹאוֹת אֶת מוֹרֶיךָ״. רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אַף אֵין הַפַּרְגּוֹד נִנְעָל בְּפָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִכָּנֵף עוֹד מוֹרֶיךָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: is satiated with the glory of the Divine Presence, as it is stated “And your eyes shall behold your Teacher.” Rabbi Aḥa, son of Ḥanina, said: Even the partition pargod is not locked before him, as it is stated: “And your Teacher shall not hide Himself anymore”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: We swear him from the splendor of the Divine Presence, as it is said: "And your eyes shall see your teachers." Rabbi Acha bar Chanina says: Even the Paragog is not locked in front of him, as it is said: "And your teachers shall not be hidden anymore."

sentences.text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵין וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם מְרוּבָּה קִלְלָתוֹ מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן עֶרֶב וּבָעֶרֶב תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן בֹּקֶר״, הֵי בֹּקֶר? אִילֵימָא בֹּקֶר דְּלִמְחַר, מִי יָדַע מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא דַּחֲלֵיף.
sentences.human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, there is no Rava says: Each and every day is more cursed than the previous one, as it is stated “In the morning you will say, would that it were evening, and in the evening you will say, would that it were morning” which morning If we say the following morning, does he know what will be Rather, that has passed;
sentences.llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: "From the day the Temple was destroyed, there is no..." Rava said: "Every day his curse is greater than his fellow's, as it is stated: 'In the morning you will say, 'If only it were evening!' and in the evening you will say, 'If only it were morning!'' Is it morning? If you say it is morning, perhaps tomorrow, who knows what will happen? Rather, it is a cycle."

sentences.text: וְאֶלָּא, עָלְמָא אַמַּאי קָא מִקַּיַּים? אַקְּדוּשָּׁה דְסִידְרָא, וְאַ״יְּהֵא שְׁמֵיהּ רַבָּא״ דְּאַגַּדְתָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶרֶץ עֵיפָתָה כְּמוֹ אֹפֶל צַלְמָוֶת וְלֹא סְדָרִים״, הָא יֵשׁ סְדָרִים — תּוֹפִיעַ מֵאוֹפֶל.
sentences.human_translation: But why does the world exist? By the sanctification that order and Let His great name of aggada . As it is stated: “A land of thick darkness, as darkness itself; a land of the shadow of death, without any order” Therefore, there are orders shall appear from the darkness.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, why is the world established? The sanctity of order, and "And His name shall be called Raba" of Aggadta, as it is said: "A land of darkness, as darkness itself, and of the shadow of death, without any order," but there is order — it emerges from darkness.

sentences.text: וְלֹא יָרַד טַל לִבְרָכָה וְנִיטַּל טַעַם פֵּירוֹת וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: טׇהֳרָה — בִּטְּלָה טַעַם וָרֵיחַ, מַעֲשֵׂר — בִּיטֵּל שׁוֹמֶן דָּגָן.
sentences.human_translation: dew has not descended for a blessing, and the taste has been removed from fruit. It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: purity has removed the taste and the aroma; tithes have removed the fat of grain.
sentences.llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And dew did not descend for blessing, and the taste of fruits was removed, etc. It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Purity - it nullified the taste and the smell, tithes - it nullified the oil of the grain."

sentences.text: רַב הוּנָא אַשְׁכַּח תּוֹמַרְתָּא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא, שַׁקְלַהּ, כַּרְכַהּ בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ. אֲתָא רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹרְחִינָא רֵיחָא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, טׇהֳרָה יֵשׁ בְּךָ. יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ, שַׁקְלַהּ, יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, שִׂמַּחְתָּ אֶת לִבִּי, וְהִקְהֵיתָה אֶת שִׁינַּי. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַחֲמֵי דְּאַבָּא — אַבְּנֵי, רַחֲמֵי דִּבְנֵי — אַבְּנֵי דְּהָווּ לֵיהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Huna found a fragrant date. He took it and wrapped it in his shawl. Rabba, his son, came said to him: I smell the aroma of a fragrant said to him: My son, there is purity in you, He gave it to him. Meanwhile, Abba, son, arrived. took gave it to said to My son, you have made my heart rejoice and you have blunted my teeth, This that people say: The love of a father is for the sons; the love of the sons is for their own sons,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Huna found a myrtle branch, he took it, tied it with its leaves. Rabba, his son, came, said to him: I smell the fragrance of myrtle. He said to him: My son, you have purity. He gave it to him. Later, Abba, his father, came, took it, gave it to him. He said to him: My son, you have gladdened my heart, and you have whitened my teeth. This is what people say: The mercies of a father - stones, the mercies of a son - stones that were his.

sentences.text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אִיטַּפַּל בֵּיהּ בְּרַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר בְּרַתֵּיה. כִּי גְדַל אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַשְׁקְיַין מַיָּא. אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו בְּרָיךְ אֲנָא. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַבִּי רַבִּי, בַּר בְּרַתָּךְ אֲנָא.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov took care of Rav Ya’akov, the son of his daughter, When grew up, said to him: Give me water to drink. He said to him: I am not your son, And this that people say: Raise, raise I am the son of your daughter,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Ahah son of Jacob prayed in the presence of Rav Jacob son of his daughter. When he grew up, he said to him: "Give me water." He said to him: "I am not a well." And this is what people say: "My master, my master, I am your son's son."

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל אַסְפַּסְיָינוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת חֲתָנִים וְעַל הָאִירוּס.
sentences.human_translation: In the war [ pulemus ] of Vespasian decreed upon the crowns of bridegrooms, and upon the drums,
sentences.llm_translation: The Mishnah: In the city of Pumbedita of Aspasyanus, they decreed regarding the crowns of grooms and regarding betrothal.

sentences.text: בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל טִיטוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת כַּלּוֹת, וְשֶׁלֹּא יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ יְווֹנִית.
sentences.human_translation: In the war of Titus they decreed upon the crowns of brides, and that a person should not teach his son Greek.
sentences.llm_translation: In the Pulumus of Titus they decreed on bridal crowns, and so that a person should not teach his son Greek.

sentences.text: בְּפוּלְמוּס הָאַחֲרוֹן גָּזְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא תֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּ שֶׁתֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר.
sentences.human_translation: In the last war, they decreed that a bride may not go out in a palanquin inside the city, but our Sages permitted a bride to go out in a palanquin inside the city,
sentences.llm_translation: In Pulumus the latter, they decreed that the bride shall not go out with a veil within the city, and our Rabbis permitted that the bride may go out with a veil within the city.

sentences.text: מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּטְלוּ מוֹשְׁלֵי מְשָׁלִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן עַזַּאי בָּטְלוּ הַשַּׁקְדָנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן זוֹמָא בָּטְלוּ הַדַּרְשָׁנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא בָּטְלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קְטֹנְתָּא פָּסְקוּ חֲסִידִים. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״קְטֹנְתָּא״ — שֶׁהָיָה קְטֹנְתָּא שֶׁל חֲסִידִים.
sentences.human_translation: From when Rabbi Meir died, those who relate parables ceased; from when ben Azzai died, the diligent ceased; from when ben Zoma died, the exegetists ceased; from when Rabbi Akiva died, the honor of the Torah ceased; from when Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa died, the men of action ceased; from when Rabbi Yosei the Small died, the pious were no more. And why was he called the Small? Because he was the smallest of the pious,
sentences.llm_translation: From the death of Rabbi Meir, the interpreters of parables ceased. From the death of Ben Azzai, the almond trees ceased. From the death of Ben Zoma, the expounders ceased. From the death of Rabbi Akiva, the honor of the Torah ceased. From the death of Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa, the men of deeds ceased. From the death of Rabbi Yosei K'tanta, the pious ceased. And why was he called "K'tanta" - because he was the smallest among the pious.

sentences.text: מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי בָּטַל זִיו הַחׇכְמָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה, וּמֵתָה טׇהֳרָה וּפְרִישׁוּת. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּאָבִי בָּטְלָה זִיו הַכְּהוּנָּה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי בָּטְלָ[ה] עֲנָוָה וְיִרְאַת חֵטְא.
sentences.human_translation: From when Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai died, the glory of wisdom ceased; from when Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and asceticism died. From when Rabbi Yishmael ben Pavi died, the glory of the priesthood ceased; from when Rabbi died, humility and fear of sin ceased.
sentences.llm_translation: From when Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai died, the splendor of wisdom ceased. From when Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and separation ceased. From when Rabbi Yishmael ben Piavi died, the radiance of the priesthood ceased. From when Rabbi died, humility and fear of sin ceased.

sentences.text: [ גְּמָ׳ ] תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן יָאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בּוֹשׁוּ חֲבֵרִים וּבְנֵי חוֹרִין, וְחָפוּ רֹאשָׁם, וְנִדַּלְדְּלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה, וְגָבְרוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעַ וּבַעֲלֵי לָשׁוֹן, וְאֵין דּוֹרֵשׁ וְאֵין מְבַקֵּשׁ וְאֵין שׁוֹאֵל,
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught: Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir says: From when the Temple was destroyed, the ḥaverim and free men were ashamed, and their heads were covered and men of action dwindled, and violent and smooth-talking men gained the upper hand, and none seek, and none ask, and none inquire
sentences.llm_translation: G'ma The Rabbis taught: Rabbi Pinchas ben Yair says: When the Temple was destroyed, friends and free men were put to shame, their heads were covered, the men of action were shaken, the strong of arm and the eloquent prevailed, and no one inquired, and no one sought, and no one asked.

sentences.text: עַל מִי לָנוּ לְהִשָּׁעֵן עַל אָבִינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
sentences.human_translation: Upon whom for us to rely? upon our Father in Heaven.
sentences.llm_translation: On whom shall we rely? On our Father in Heaven.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ שָׁרוֹ חַכִּימַיָּא לְמֶהֱוֵי כְּסָפְרַיָּא, וְסָפְרַיָּא כְּחַזָּנַיָּא, וְחַזָּנַיָּא כְּעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא, וְעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the day the Temple was destroyed, Scholars have begun to become like scribes and scribes have become like beadles, and beadles have become like ignoramuses, and ignoramuses
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the day the Temple was destroyed, the wise scholars have become like scribes, the scribes like synagogue attendants, the synagogue attendants like common people, and the common people like donkeys.
